Reviews.Title: “A place to remember”
Reviews.Author: J_Legal
Reviews.Content: This say was my longest ever in Las Vegas. I'm there on a regular basis for business, so often that I have seen everything on the Strip! I am looking for a place to stay that feels just like home. This is exactly what I have found at this hotel. The apartments are clean, modern and spacious with well appointed kitchen and the convenience of an in-room washer and dryer. Great service, convenient to everything, I will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: thealinda
Reviews.Content: We were in Vegas for 12 days on business and did not want to stay on the strip. This place was perfect - close enough to everything but also quiet. The rooms were beautiful and clean. Our balcony looked out on the lovely pool which we did not have time to use but it looked great. Breakfast was very good but the dinners were so so. There is a free shuttle to the airport and the MGM. all in all it is a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel to stay with kids while in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: HikerMom58
Reviews.Content: Our vacation had us fly in and out of Vegas. On the inbound we stayed on the Strip and that was enough for us. On the way back we stayed at Staybridge - a family favourite chain. The rooms here are quite lovely and modern. The service was impeccable. We did have one problem...while eating our dinner I started to smell what I thought was tobacco smoke (it ended up being marijuana)...odd as it is a non-smoking hotel. It got stronger so called the desk...the staff came down to check it out and said there had been some concern with the room next to ours. They very quickly moved us and our former neighbour paid his fine ...once again everyone was quick to apologize...but I am getting tired with hotels when you have a problem they figure a slightly larger room and said sorry...the space was not required as within 5 minutes we were all in bed and headed out to airport in the am...no follow-up, no discount, no extra points for loyalty club....

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Place”
Reviews.Author: AD19EW
Reviews.Content: Spacious, reasonable, decent breakfast - great place, highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect service”
Reviews.Author: Graham l
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Staybridge Suite and found the staff to be very helpful and attentive.Everyone was so friendly, and the hotel was in a perfect location. I would highly recommend this Hotel for a stay in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “The best way to do Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: scooterpervy
Reviews.Content: Fantastic facility, a short cab ride from the Strip. You could walk it, but who walks in Vegas!? I guess that if you want to be in a casino hotel it would fall short, but as a non-gambler with two teens, the excellent facilities, kitchenette, massive bathroom and superb outdoor pool, combined with a phenomenal 50% price discount, make it a superb location. I would recommend this to all but hardcore party animals, and that's because I don't want them ruining it for the rest of us.....

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Krissy16250
Reviews.Content: Lovely clean very comfortable hotel, lovely staff, excellent service! Completely smoke free is a bonus. Comfortable, good sized room with all amenities of an apartment. Excellent choice of complimentary breakfast foods & beverages. In a quiet location away from the strip, which is exactly what we wanted, so a car is necessary. Will stay here again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Free Airport Shuttle, Free Breakfast, and no casino, I love it”
Reviews.Author: Jim L
Reviews.Content: Not that there is anything wrong with Casinos, it's Vegas. It's nice to be able to return to a nice quiet lobby, no cigarette smoke and drunk people everywhere. I like that there are all the ammenities of an apartment, it helps on the food costs as Las Vegas restaurants are expensive. I really can't complain about anything except it is off the strip, and there's not much around it in the immediate area.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Property but car is needed”
Reviews.Author: cobaorbust_12
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Vegas and the reviews of this hotel convinced us to stay here. We were not disappointed as all other reviews are bang on. We emailed the hotel and requested a Delux King 5th floor on strip side and that's exactly what we got when we arrived. Staff are all excellent and the full breakfast and Sundowner appies we're always very good. The hotel is only 5 minutes from the strip, however, you are always planning around the shuttle that leaves every hour. I would recommend renting a car as we spent too much time in shuttle, buses and cabs. Even though the Staybridge was nice to come home after the gruelling 5-10 miles of walking each day, I think a hotel on the strip is in our plans for our next trip to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Always happy with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Patrick Z
Reviews.Content: I had stayed at this hotel at other locations and knew what to expect. The breakfast, the service, location & everything! The even have a free shuttle to the airport and MGM (the strip). Save yourself the hassle if you don't have a car, buy a 24 hr bus pass for $7 and it takes you up and down the strip even to Freemont! The express bus has less stops hint hint! The outlet mall on the north side is better! FYI

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: TheBigDaddy
Reviews.Content: I basically live in motels due to the nature of my work and this was my first stay at a Staybridge Suites. I was shocked at the level of detail in the rooms. I will now be looking at these properties a little more. While I was there the internet continued to give me problems. When I called the internet provider they would fix it but it always came back. I will stay here again if the internet is fixed. The reason I rate the service low is due to the fact that the property pushes the burden of repairing the internet off on you the customer.

Reviews.Title: “trust the reviews! this place is great!”
Reviews.Author: dunkirk2
Reviews.Content: Having a full apartment makes all the difference during an extended stay and we used the oven/cooktop /microwave to prepare most of our meals "at home". Cleanup was easy with the full size dishwasher. The large fridge- freezer has an icemaker too. Duel sinks in the bathroom, a built in washer and dryer and private balcony are the icing on this delectable condo-cake! The breakfast haS plenty of selections and the staff is super friendly! The shuttle service to and from the strip/airport was another super bonus! WE SHALL RETURN!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great option inVegas!”
Reviews.Author: MarySP
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not located on the Strip (Las Vegas Boulevard), but it's less than 5 min drive from there. In my opinion, it is the best hotel in Vegas if you plan to have a car during your stay. Reasons: 1- It's not one of those gigantic cassino hotels where you have to walk for 20 minutes to get to your room. 2- Parking is free and there's always space - so you don't have to wait for the valet to park and bring your car (and tip him) but you also won't have to drive around for hours looking for a space. 3- Breakfast is included and it is very good. I saw several reviews complaining that they always ran out of items at the buffet, but I stayed there for 10 days, had breakfast on most of them and didn't have this issue. 4- There are no resort fees and wireless internet is avaliable for free. 5- The rooms are very big and even have a full kitchen in case you want to cook. 6- Location is great, you're less than 5 min drive away from the Strip, and because it's not on the strip, you can use alternative ways to avoid traffic. 7- It's not the cheapest hotel in Vegas, but I thought it had a good cost/benefit ratio. The only negative point of this hotel is about their cleanning schedule. They have a police to only fully clean your room once a week - during weekdays they will only replace towels, take off trash and do the beds, and they won't do anything on weekends. That was ok with me, but I think it should have been better planned... I stayed there for 10 days, and they only fully cleaned the room on day 8, when we were about to leave... Not very cleaver in my opinion. I definitly would stay there again. I would only not recommend this hotel if you plan to stay in Vegas without a car. In this case, even though the hotel has a complimentary shuttle (I didn't use it, so I don't know if it's good), I think the best option would be to stay in one of the cassinos on the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Off the Strip Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cwousar
Reviews.Content: This Staybridge Hotel is a hidden gem in Las Vegas. As a businessman, I wanted a quiet hotel where I could relax and do a little work. The hotel is great. Each room is a suite with breakfast provided. The staff is friendly and very helpful. I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Not at all what others have experienced - Beware!!”
Reviews.Author: 4travelreview
Reviews.Content: Based on previous reviews on Trip Advisor, we reserved a room for 2 adults and 2 children. We were told that the only accomodations for 4 were a king bed and sleeper sofa, but that the room would be made up for the four of us. In addition to our written reservation, we also placed 3 phone calls to make sure the room was set correctly. We arrived at 7:00 pm and checked in. The sofa bed was not made up. We called the front desk and were told no one else was working at the hotel except the shuttle driver who was out driving, but on his return, he would come up and make the bed. After waiting 45 minutes to an hour, with still no return of the shuttle driver, we asked for sheets to make it up ourselves. We were told no. No managment on duty until the next day. Hotel room was not very clean. The breakfast buffet was missing several items, supposedly because of machines out of order. Dirty plates and silverware mixed in with the clean. We tried to talk with a manager the next morning and were avoided. After several emails back and forth with no apologies, only blame toward us, they finally took $50 off and removed a pet fee. With a bill for $300, this seems inadequate to say the least. We had been traveling all day and just wanted to go to bed. Instead it took several hours to get sheets thrown over (not even tucked in) a sleeper sofa for our daughters. Our reservation paperwork clearly showed 4 people. The manager's excuse was that they are a "suites" hotel with king beds and not set up for families. With no managment or staff other than a desk clerk and shuttle driver on duty in Las Vegas at 7:00pm, they are ill prepared for any guests arrival. With the poor housekeeping in the room and breakfast room, it is very questionable what level of service they will provide at all. Very disappointing after reading other reviews on Trip Advisor. The manager's fall back was to send copies of phone logs which did not accurately portray what my phone calls had even been about and he completely ignored what my reservation paperwork showd. Stay away! Too many good choices in Las Vegas to deal with this poor management and poor service.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice”
Reviews.Author: TwizzleNottingham
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay here. We arrived on Thanksgiving and received a complimentary Thanksgiving Meal. The receptionist was very helpful and patient with our questions as this was our first visit to Las Vegas. The room was spacious, spotless, and we appreciated the kitchen. We didnt use the shuttle service ourselves we preferred to walk but others might find it too far. After the madness of the strip it was great to return to some peace and quiet!. Breakfast was excellent with a choice of hot and cold foods which were regularly replaced by efficient staff.

Reviews.Title: “Home, Suite Home”
Reviews.Author: Cherimabrie
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at this hotel and it was the best experience. We felt so comfortable and with young children that's important. The room decor was current and the cleanliness was impeccable. To top it all off breakfast was amazing. The staff was pleasant and warm when checking in and out of our room. Sales Manager Star Persley helped us book an incredible room with a view of the Vegas strip. The Staybridge is conveniently located near the strip and the shuttle service makes for nice travel to and from the near by casinos. To sum it all up, when planning a trip to Vegas, the hustle and bustle of the strip hotels will have to take a back seat. We will stay at the Staybridge.

Reviews.Title: “One of the nicest Staybridge Hotels I stayed at”
Reviews.Author: ClevAP
Reviews.Content: This hotel is only a few years old. It is very clean, rooms very large, close to the Strip (across the Highway I-15 from Mandalay Bay). Their free breakfast is great. Free shuttle to MGM and airport. I would recommend this to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth being off the strip.”
Reviews.Author: missbeebirmingham
Reviews.Content: All the positive reviews are exactly right about this hotel. It is also fantastic value for Las Vegas (or anywhere in the USA to be frank). The hotel shuttle was a great service, and if we missed it, a cab wasn't so expensive. The hotel was very clean and modern. Room not quite as big as I'd hoped, but luxurious and clean. Nice bathroom, and balcony view. Great swimming pool and jacuzzi. Staff were helpful. Free breakfasts and early bird buffet dinners were good (not usual Vegas strip hotel standard), but what do you want for free! The only negative thing I have to say, is because there are no nearby shops to reach on foot, essentials like water and washing powder (for the laundry room) are a little on the pricey side. But saves hiring a car! Stay here - you won't regret it.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT HOTEL !”
Reviews.Author: JetterJ
Reviews.Content: This Staybridge Suites is a hidden gem in the hustle and bustle of Las Vegas. Just off the corner of Mandalay Bay it is close enough to the strip to enjoy it without being in that "strip" atmosphere. The hotel is incredible- we had a full kitchen as well as a washer and dryer in the room! ( oh yeah- and a full size dining room table with 6 chairs!) The balcony was an added surprise we didn't know about in advance! The front desk was able to meet both requests we had: top floor & facing the strip. It was very neat to sit out on the balcony and take in all the beautiful lights of Vegas at night. The room was spotless. Bed super soft and nice bedding to go with it. The living room had gigantic sectional which allowed us all to stretch out and watch a little TV during down time. The food the hotel offered at both the breakfast AND the sundowner meal was excellent. Especially the grilled burgers and hot dogs. ( both breakfast and sundowner meal included in price of the room) The parking lot was nice and safe - no issues leaving a car parked. Took advantage of the shuttle bus that ran to the MGM every hour whenever possible. We were SO glad not to have to traipse through a HUGE casino to get to our room at the end of a long tiring day. Seemed a little pricey - but was worth the extra money. Will stay there again when we go back to Las Vegas!! PS- forgot to mention: NO lines to check in ( some hotels in Vegas have up to a half hour wait just to check in!) AND no waiting in lines for an elevator to get to room ( AGAIN - HUGE BUSY HOTELS = HUGE LINES TO GET INTO THE ELEVATOR!!) THINK ABOUT IT PEOPLE!! IT BECOMES A REAL PAIN IN THE BUTT !!

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: KittyChan
Reviews.Content: I had to book a Vegas hotel for a weekend at fairly short notice last month, and Staybridge came up on my list of possibilities for Marriott-group hotels offering U.S. Government rates for my dates. I checked the hotel's reviews on TripAdvisor and booked the (very good) rate. I wasn't disappointed. Staybridge is as other reviewers have described: clean, comfortable, and (mostly) pretty quiet. I arrived at noon, and the front-desk clerk apologized that my "one-bedroom suite" wouldn't be ready until around 3 p.m.: not surprising, given the hotel's popularity and a weekend stay. What was surprising was the offer of the suite, as I'd only booked the standard king-bed studio. (The clerk said that Staybridge normally upgrades government reservations to the suites when available.) I asked if one of those was ready; it was, and I was on my way. The studio was fine. I was at the end of the hall and thus right next to a stairway, which proved to be much more convenient for parking and quick access to the lobby. (The elevators were located pretty far down the hall.) The room itself, while narrow, was well laid out, with all the good conveniences and features that others have noted: big bathroom, full kitchen, comfortable sitting area, up-to-date LCD TV, and balcony. I even had a good view (over Russell Rd.) of the southern end of the Strip. Staybridge's location is a plus: just west of the Strip, off Russell Rd., in its own quiet little zoned subdivision (as with so much in Vegas). Getting to and back from the Strip was thus a breeze, and there's convenient parking ringing the hotel. I had a rather noisy family staying next to me, but the sound wasn't too bad. Staybridge seems to be a bit bitter than average on this score for its three-star category; indeed, the overall quality and the amenities of this well-maintained four-year old property would appear to justify a four-star classification. Good job, Staybridge.

Reviews.Title: “Alternative Vegas”
Reviews.Author: jezzieboy
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after reading the many positive reviews and we were not disappointed. The staff are friendly and helpful and the suites large, modern and very well equiped. Cleanliness was also to a high standard. Perfect for a Vegas stay away from The Strip, smoking and gambling free. Ideal as we had a young child with us and really came to Vegas for the Canyon and Hoover Dam, not for Vegas life. Free breakfast was fine with a good selection but we did not try the free dinner option. Free shuttle to and from MGM Grand was useful. Overall would recommend highly with one proviso. We requested and got a pool view suite, which looks over the smart pool area and a couple of similar small hotels and an industrial area. However this hotel is close to the airport and aircraft noise started early and was very frequent during the morning. It woke me several times. This would apply to many hotels in this area and is worth noting if you sleep lightly. Rooms on the Freeway side have a view of the strip and possibly some freeway noise but maybe the aircaraft noise would be less. Other reviewers have noted how quiet the hotel is and certainly internal noise was none existant so it may just be my sensitivity to planes. But this is the only reason I have not awarded the hotel an excellent rating.

Reviews.Title: “A tranquil retreat from the hustle and bustle”
Reviews.Author: margsSouthYorkshire
Reviews.Content: We have just spent 5 nights at the Staybridge and I have not got a single complaint about it. The suite was on the 5th floor with a view of the strip and was spotlessly clean.You can't hear the traffic at all unless you open the patio door.The bed was very big and comfy! No problem sleeping at all.We had washer and dryer, full kitchen- no kettle though - (felllow Brits!) apparently it is not usual to get these in American kitchens! We really liked the pool - it is never crowded and you get complimentary towels on the loungers. There's a smashing hot tub and the saltwater pool itself is warm and kept very clean - we saw the chap checking the water and putting the chairs and tables in order every time we went.You do get aircraft noise by the pool but it didn't spoil it for us at all. The breakfasts are really good to say they are free- as good as any 5 star hotel in our opinion. Hot dishes ( bacon eggs and sausage patties), cereals, fruit, yogurt, toast, pastries plus juice and coffee. We didn't go to the evening meals so don't know whats on offer there. I would recommend the Staybridge to anyone who prefers an "away from it all" place to stay with easy access to the Interstate and the Strip. We will return - no question!

Reviews.Title: “"Great hotel just off of the strip"”
Reviews.Author: 123neels
Reviews.Content: this is a great hotel just south of the strip. if you need to go to city center or the airport, but don't want the noise, then you have the right place. the hotel is very clean, and the staff are attentive to your needs. The heated saltwater pool has a fire pit on its deck, there are two hot tubs, there are three cabanas that you don't have to pay for. the gym on the second floor is a fairly nice gym for a hotel. the breakfast that is included is very sufficient. I will definitely stay here again. the beds and water pressure are great as well.

Reviews.Title: “Believe the reviews: this is the ideal base in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: ourholiday
Reviews.Content: The Staybridge is a great place to stay. It's just off the strip, with a courtesy shuttle every hour, the suites are excellent and we found the reception staff very helpful. The pool is very warm and large, the breakfast fine and the free dinner on Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday a nice bonus. HIghly recommended overall.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Impressed”
Reviews.Author: yyclhryyc
Reviews.Content: I am usually a HIE regular for business. I come to LV often and usually stay on the strip. This was my first time staying off-strip and decided to stay at the Staybridge after reading the + reviews and after a very good stay at a Staybridge in Utah. I booked a regular suite but was upgraded to a corner 1 bedroom king suite as a Priority Club Platinum member. The room has a "wow" factor. It is very big and modern. There is a full size kitchen which was great. There even is in-suite laundry. All applicances were hi-end. The bed was extremely comfortable. Two flat screen tvs. View of Mandalay Bay from pation and picture window. Staff were very pleasant and accommodating. Today I will be moving to the Bellagio for a 3-day comp stay, but am seriously consider staying at the Staybridge even though I have to pay. This is how much I love it. If you don't mind staying off the strip or have a vehicle, then I would highly recommend this Staybridge. Parking is adequate and seems secure (not sure if there is security). The only negatives ("negatives" is perhaps a bit strong, perhaps "neutrals") is that the room was set to 80 degrees when I first came in the room and I immediately turned it down to 68 degrees and after an overnight the temperature only made it down to 71 degrees. There is only one thermostat and 2 vents. The room may be too big. The other comment is that there is no soap dish/shampoo holder in the shower enclosure.

Reviews.Title: “Extra value stay: very nice staff and very nice room (large, clean,comfortable)”
Reviews.Author: Galera_u_veru
Reviews.Content: Close to everything , but located aside from the strip (which was good to us as a family), quiet (no traffic or airplane noise), and very affordable, we had a chance to experience the very kindness of staff because our son got very sick when we stayed there. Half price five star hotel, best bet in Vegas I am sure

Reviews.Title: “More than pleasantly surprised.”
Reviews.Author: wattbro
Reviews.Content: Well more than pleasantly surpised to say the least! When my cycling group, Major Motion, booked this hotel as our spot for the Viva Vegas Century ride I immediately checked the website for details; I'm really "into" where I stay. The website pics were quite cool and the pricing was on par or slightly better than anything similar I could get with any discount. I called and spoke with Star Persley, sales manager and contact for our stay, to discuss details and my room preference. She was very nice over the phone, totally pumped about the property and certain I'd be pleased...I was very pleased! The location was perfect, close to the strip but not in the mix. The grounds were very well kept and the rooms, I had a 1 bedroom suite, were immaculate! New furnishings with a modern architectural flair, great view of the strip and ample natural light; the patio can be accessed from both living room and bedroom. The kitchen's nicely appointed and the bathroom compliments. All said, I've made this location one of my "Vegas Favorites" and would highly recommend it to anyone seeking a location of this type. By the way, the entire staff, day and night, were very cool. The complementary breakfast after the previous days' 100mi ride, also very cool. All said, if you want my advice, stay at the Staybridge! Cheers, Raj

Reviews.Title: “Can not be beat for value, cleanliness and quality. This is my third stay here. The staff is friendly and accommodating. The poo”
Reviews.Author: CaryNC2
Reviews.Content: Can not be beat for value, cleanliness and quality. This is my third stay. The staff is friendly and accommodating. The pool is peaceful and pretty . The rooms are beautiful. I love it here and return again and again. Oh and the breakfast is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great Find”
Reviews.Author: janeandallen
Reviews.Content: We had 2 nights there. Great hotel off the madness of the strip, but just a one block walk to Mandalay Bay Conference Centre, plus there is a free shuttle. We had a one bedroom suite and it was huge. We could have sat 6 for dinner and 8 watching TV. Room was nice and clean, with a fully fitted kitchen. Good free wi-fi. Good pool, although a little noisy with the planes taking off from LAS. Plenty of recliners and some cabanas. Good fitness room, with 2 of the major aerobic machines. Good complimentary breakfast - hot and cold options with fruit. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good price ~ Good concept”
Reviews.Author: Gr8erEscapes
Reviews.Content: This hotel must be very new as there are a lot of kinks to be worked out ~ with housekeeping being it's weakest point. The rooms are great ~ we had a nicely furnished bedroom, full kitchen, bath and living room. The room was very dusty when we checked in; it seemed that our supplies were replenished on a whim (ex: lots of shampoo but no TP); and, one day, the cleaning of our room was completely overlooked. The kitchen was nicely supplied with glasses, dinnerware, utensils, etc. ~ except there was only ONE pan ~ a frying pan with no lid. (And, the front desk confirmed that this was correct ~ go figure ~ a full-sized stove and only one pan?) The Bond Lounge (on the premises) is open Friday thru Monday for beer and wine and light meals; however, on the Saturday we checked in, they had NO food ~ citing a delivery/order problem. They said they would not have any food to serve until the following Monday. This sort of disorganization and inexperience prevailed and over-shadowed an otherwise nice extended stay concept. BTW, you can get a room with a great view of the strip, but it sits right at the intersection of (busy) Russell and the I15 ~ noisy, despite the dual-paned windows, and rendering the little patio useless. The sound-proofing in the walls is not very good ~ we had a family in the room next door one night and it seemed as if the four of them were right in the room with us. I doubt I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Peaks & Troughs”
Reviews.Author: stanley23913548
Reviews.Content: The Good, the Bad & the Ugly in that order If you've got wheels, this hotel is in a great location to take advantage of nearby arterial roads such as I-15, I-215 & I-95. No wheels, no problem. They have a shuttle that transports guests to and from the strip. The hotel has spacious suites that are well equiped and outclass the competition in their class, such as Embassy Suites.The fitness room is bigger than most I've stayed in. But..... Two types of amenities thast are tie breakers for me, are hot-tubs/whirlpools, and a "full breakfast". The full breakfast is poor in comparison to the afore-mentioned competition. The staff in this area appears to be limited in numbers. If one member doesn't turn up, then as happened, the full breakfast became continental. The remaining young Lady to her credit, worked like a trojan to try and compensate, but there was still no hot food. On other shifts, people like Adolpho, were very personable and reliable and a full breakfast ensued.. The hot-tubs, of which there were two adjacent to the heated outdoor pool, were cold tubs. The front desk staff weren't aware that they were out of service, and that parts were awaiting. Doesn't say much for the communication between maintenance and front desk. And... Timing is everything with the shuttle service. If you book a return shuttle time that coincides with the time of the front desk shift change, and the fact that you are waiting for the said vehicle as you bake in the afternoon sun outside the MGM, but the handover/takeover doesn't bear mention of your request to be picked up, then as they say, you will be hung out to dry, literally. I can attest to this, and apparently, it's not an uncommon event. If the troughs could be expunged, then this place is great value. However, there is a certain amount of denial by management, and thus I expect similar negative events to transpire. You either want return business, and optimize occupancy levels, or you inadvertantly and unwittingly, become unpaid representatives of your competition. I'd like to return, but a culture change must ensue. If you bring any of these issues to the staff's attention, then those big beaming smiles that greet you on arrival, are replaced by testiness. I know, some of us are just too picky and should be more forgiving, and I'm sure others had better experiences, but last week, I doubt it. As harsh as this critique seems, if this place was firing on all cylinders, then it would be hard to find better value, and it's parent company would be well pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Love This Place”
Reviews.Author: Anoini2
Reviews.Content: Staybridge-LAS I love this hotel!  I already like Staybridge but this is not your typical Staybridge hotel.  I can now understand why it's one of TA's top-rated hotel in Las Vegas.  The hotel is NOT on the strip which was perfectly fine with me. I would rather stay here than the strip anyway.  It's like a refuge from the craziness of the strip. Check-in was great and we were upgraded to a king one-bedroom suite for being a priority club member.  The room was  beautiful and it overlooks the pool and we had a private balcony.  Our suite had a full size kitchen with everything you need IF you want to cook.  There was even a full size washer and dryer on the suite.  How sweet is that!! Just bring your laundry detergent so you dont have to buy one downstairs.  The bathroom was clean and spacious actually the whole suite was spacious. WIFI had great signal which was great. There was a tv in the living room and one in the bedroom. Checked out the pool area and it was like a mini resort with four cabanas and you are not getting charged extra for it. There was two hot tubs, a wadding pool next to the large pool.  When we were there, someone was painting the floor in the pool area, this place is well-maintained.   Breakfast was great, as expected with Staybridge. I always like their oatmeal and the bowls were larger than the Staybridge I stayed at.  The breakfast area was beautiful and overlooks the pool and a decent size.  They also have a sun downer on Tues, Wed, Thur.  This hotel has very good, not only do you get free hot breakfast, you also get free dinner on TWT.  Plus, free WIFI, great resort like pool and amenities and great service.  The only negative that I can think of was the small dish detergent seemed watered down. The color looked right but it was watery oh and I saw one popcorn on the floor but that's really trying hard to find fault.  I can't wait to stay here again.   For helpful tip: Restaurants:  Japonais at Mirage was amazing, service was great too, I think everything in their menu are all good, you really can't go wrong.  It's pricey but worth it. Also went to Stacks at the Mirage.  Ugh, we waited over half an hour for our seats and the hostess said it will only be less than ten minutes and there were plenty of tables available. Great food though but the service was awful. Qua at Ceasars was great and the Imperial Spa has great body scrub and only charges a fraction of the price than the spas at the Strip. BEST Foot Spa on Rainbow Blvd has the best massage and great rates too.  BTW, these are NOT the happy ending kind of businesses and are legitimately decent.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel at an affordable price”
Reviews.Author: RJ_70
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 2 nights and were sorry we didn't have longer. The room was huge and extremely well furnished. The balcony offered a view across to the strip, and although the hotel is a short distance away from the main attractions of Vegas, there is an hourly free shuttle to both the strip and the airport. We particularly enjoyed the pool and jacuzzi after a day of trawling the strip. The complementary breakfast, and mid-week buffet were also very welcome. Would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Oasis off the Strip”
Reviews.Author: jstm58
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews before booking this property as I wanted to stay away from the Vegas strip but be able to access it. This hotel did not disappoint. They have a free shuttle that runs every hour til 10pm. We had a 1 bedroom suite with full kitchen even though they provide a hot breakfast. Staff is friendly and service oriented. Decor is contemporary and most rooms have tall windows for viewing the mountains and lights of the strip. Our suite even had its own washer/dryer. It was quiet and a good choice for us as we did some sightseeing outside Vegas and their free parking and easy location to freeway came in handy.

Reviews.Title: “Superior Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: wyzik
Reviews.Content: My employers' training center is in Las Vegas, and this is one of their recommended hotels. It's easy to see why. The suites are large, very modern, and in immaculate condition. While more of an "extended stay" business hotel than what most people think of when they think of a hotel, this property has enough amenities and services to make a stay pleasant. Overall, I look forward to my stays here--it's nicer than some places I've lived!

Reviews.Title: “What a perfect alternative to the busy, noisy strip hotels!”
Reviews.Author: golfedegem
Reviews.Content: I stayed here last March and picked this hotel based on the Tripadvisor reviews (as usual) and believe me, I was not disappointed! The hotel is just minutes away from everything you will need. There is a major highway right outside and there was road work at that time, but I never heard the traffic. The breakfast is as can be expected and the suites are spacious and very clean. Of course you need a car and with this highway just in front of the hotel you are just a short drive to the strip, the malles, the factory outlet, the Callaway golf learning center and the airport. Tempus fugit, time passes very fast in Vegas but you'll find some rest in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay at a Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TrueNorthFamily
Reviews.Content: We spent a week in Las Vegas at the end of August and I wished we had chosen this hotel first. From the moment we walked into the Staybridge Suites I knew we would love it. I had reviewed several hotels before our trip and the Staybridge was one of the frontrunners. On our fourth day we drove here and were very lucky they still had rooms. The previous night they were fully booked. Once we arrived I was greeted by a friendly front desk clerk. I don't remember her name but she immediately made us feel welcome. After our previous hotel, I was hesitant about booking a room without seeing it. The staff were very nice and within 20 minutes showed us two newly cleaned suites. Both were gorgeous rooms. We paid a little extra since they only had two rooms left and chose one of the largest suites. It was amazing. Our room faced the awesome pool. The room itself was large and spacious. Main features were a full size kitchen, washer/dryer, dining-room table for four, large living-room sectional which made into a bed, large LCD TV, separate King bedroom with another LCD TV, en-suite with double sinks, nice sized tub, separate bathroom with toilet, shower and sink. There also was a small balcony with 2 chairs and a small table. I only wish the door came with some instructions on how to lock/unlock it. Figuring that out was a challenge. The room was clean and stocked with a couple items like coffee and a small bag of popcorn. We cooked a few nights in the room which was great but the range fan is not vented outside. It just blows into the room. ? The king bed was very comfortable with higher quality bed linens and great pillows. Finally I was able to get a good nights sleep. This was a welcome surprise and much needed. The pool is salt water which surprised us. My kids were not so sure about it. One hated it but soon became used to it, loved it and never wanted to leave. All this despite the incredible heat. It is fairly deep for little children but is really great for emerging swimmers. The shallow end is about 3 1/2 feet and dips to around 5 feet. There is a ledge around the whole pool which was great. The pool is large and was never crowded. There is a section that is shallow and is nicely designed with a waterfall feature. Just behind the waterfall are showers and bathrooms. One thing to note is the Staybridge keeps their pool area clean and the pool water is checked every morning. I saw someone out each morning performing pool maintenance. There is also an abundance of pool loungers with towels on each one, and patio tables with umbrellas to enjoy. One thing I should mention is when outside it is fairly noisy from airline traffic. It is so loud at times you cannot hear the music playing around the pool or one another for that matter. This was an okay trade off for us since we loved the hotel, the pool and the staff. A great thing about the Staybridge is the free breakfast in the morning. They also have a few nights a week where they serve light supper but we missed those. At any rate, the breakfast is hot and served fresh in the morning. The dining room is nicely decorated and is kept clean. At the buffet you could find eggs, omelettes, biscuits, sausages, bacon, fruit salad, fresh whole fruit, hot oatmeal, coffee, tea, juices, milk, yogourt, waffles, bagels, bread and muffins. The staff was very nice, the patrons were equally as nice and you couldn't ask for a better way to start the day. This hotel is in a great location too. It's located southwest of the Mandalay Bay. It's close to the highway with easy accessibility to many places and is only minutes away from the airport. The Las Vegas Town Center, and both the North and South outlets are only minutes away. Not far down the highway west is a larger outdoor mall area with a Walmart and other stores. I believe it is called Arroyo Center. Housekeeping consists of emptying trash, refreshing towels and making beds. If you're staying for 7 nights or more, they'll do a more thorough cleaning. One thing to note is on weekends there is no housekeeping unless requested. We stayed over a weekend and I have never experienced this type of service or lack of service before. I can make my own bed and rehang my own towels but I really could have used some cleaning supplies for the sinks. For the price you pay for this hotel a light cleaning included with the housekeeping would have been nice. Other than housekeeping concerns, we really enjoyed our 4 night stay at this hotel. In future trips to Las Vegas, we will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Accommodations!”
Reviews.Author: ciscospudd
Reviews.Content: I travel frequently both professionally and personally, and I will say that our experience at the Staybridge Suites in Las Vegas has been top-notch. First impressions go a long way and when checking in at a hotel you can learn a lot based on your interaction with the staff at the front desk. During check-in, Jody was professional, friendly, knowledgable, and succint. Kudos Jody and thank you for your time. The second impressions that you usually get at a hotel is the room itself, and at the Staybridge in Vegas, I will say that it is one of the cleanest hotels I have ever stayed. Additonally the rooms are spacious and more than adequate for a stay in LV whether you are visiting for business or vacation. Our room had a great view of the various hotels and the neon lighting on the strip, sans the hustle and bustle of the strip! The A/C worked excellent and we were in LV during the hottest month ever recorded. The hotel offers hourly shuttle services to the strip (MGM); this is a 12 minute endeavor. We caught a show at the Caesars Palace (Rod Stewart) and used the courtesy shuttle. The driver was a safe driver, and personable. We did catch a cab home from Caesars to Staybridge and paid $15.00 which included a tip just to give you an idea of taxi prices. The bottom line: I would highly recommend Staybridge Suites for your LV endeavors and will stay here again the next time we visit.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, you will be pleasantly suprised.....”
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey H
Reviews.Content: As a business traveler who stays in hotels approximately 275 nights a year, I have to honestly say that this property is everything a business traveler could ask for... In room laundry facilities, full kitchens and large spacious upscale suites as well as the most convenient access to all locations in the Las Vegas valley. I have been staying at this property when in Vegas since May 2009 when I happened to discover it. I had stayed at most all other properties in Vegas previously, and always choose this property now when in Vegas... The staff of courteous professionals are outstanding and make it a priority to make you feel at home. If staying in Vegas short term or long term on business make sure to contact "Star Persley" in sales. Star is wonderful and most helpful in assuring your reservations and accommodations are perfect for your individual situation. This property is perfect for the long term, short term business traveler as well as family friendly for the vacation travelers or professionals during the transition phase of re-location. If you have stayed at other Staybridge locations in other cities around the country, you are in for a pleasant surprise, as this property is unlike any other I have stayed at (and I have stayed at many). This property was originally built as a timeshare (as I have been told) and affords all the comforts of home. You will not be disappointed...

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel, better than Desert Rose Resort.”
Reviews.Author: latham_10
Reviews.Content: Really lovely hotel. Looks new and very clean rooms. Everything you could need. Great buffet breakfast. Lovely pool area which was always quiet. Would come here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for business or leisure”
Reviews.Author: rtvbiztrav
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable hotel and a great value. Easy access to the "Strip". All suites are large and very comfortable with full kitchens and washer/dryer right in the room. Even balconies which is rare for Vegas. Hot breakfast every morning and dinner TWT nights. Nice pool area too. Friendy helpful staff, and very thorough housekeeping.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC!”
Reviews.Author: letsgo l
Reviews.Content: Great use of room very spacious! Breakast every day and dinenr 3 nights a week. FANTASTIC place for the crowds. Pool is excellent

Reviews.Title: “Wish I could've stayed longer!”
Reviews.Author: bostechboy
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. Located close to McCarren Airport, it provides great views of planes coming for a landing - they seemed to be at eye level as they approached the airport flying by, but they were far enough away so as not seem noisy. The sruuite was gorgeous, clean, and modern.staff is very friendly. I paid under $100 per night to stay at what seems like a 5-star hotel. It's not located on the strip, which s nice if you want the option of being close to the strip, but don't want the noise. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Had a bigger room than last time”
Reviews.Author: CS6
Reviews.Content: Bit weird in that it had three sinks, in fact four if you count the one in the kitchen, but it was a huge room. But anyway the reason I'm writing another review is that I was definitely right about the pillows, they are on the hard side and harder than average for an IHG brand hotel. No idea why, but I brought my own pillow with me the second time. Also I had a hell of a job locking the door to the patio. But anyway these minor niggles aside it is a great hotel, shame about the roadworks.

Reviews.Title: “elegant room & no bedbugs”
Reviews.Author: travelmystic
Reviews.Content: In a city where bedbugs are the "hidden" secret. This hotel is bedbug free and really understands the travelers fear of bringing the little buggers home. Our one bedroom king suite on the top floor was spotless, beautiful and an easy walk to the casinos. we liked it so much we booked a night for our trip home, rather than staying with family. The room we had on our return trip was a studio and although smaller was just as nice. The marble entry, huge bathrooms and fully equipped kitchen with granite counters and comfortable beds are well worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: Babs200
Reviews.Content: We spent the last two days of our vacation to the Grand Canyon in Las Vegas. We found this hotel by using our priority club points for the room. This is one of the best hotels we have ever stayed in! Our suite had a full size kitchen with refridgerator, dishwasher, range and stackable washer and dryer. There was a separate dining area with a table and six chairs and a large sectional sofa in the living room. The flat panel t.v. was a nice size on a large cabinet with plenty of storage for clothes, dvd's etc. Directly off the living room is a walk out balcony with lounge chairs and a small table. Our view was the Las Vegas strip just across the freeway from the hotel. We chose a room with a King size bed. There was another nice flat panel t.v. in the bedroom. The bathroom had a generous size double sink vanity with a deep soaking tub. In a separate room was another vanity with a walk in shower and the toliet. If pressed for time, two people could take baths at the same time since there is a shower and tub. We really enjoyed relaxing in the spacious bathroom. We've had better hotel breakfasts. The eggs were cold and rubbery. Other food items were ok but nothing special. The fact that it's included made it tolerable. The hotel had a beautiful pool area that we unfortunately did not have a chance to use since our time was limited. When in Las Vegas again, we will definately stay at the Staybridge Suites again!

Reviews.Title: “6 weeks here was nice”
Reviews.Author: mrlittlejohn
Reviews.Content: Let me say that this is a great place to stay. Very comfortable rooms. Very well equipped. Easy location in and out of. Let me tell you about the 2 dissappointing factors. 1) I was there on business. This is a long term stay facility. And when there on business, DO NOT expect good internet service. Their speed factor is right on par with dial up. I complained several times. They just responded like they have NEVER heard about this problem. I even tried the CAT5 cable connection and no change at all. As a matter of fact, my company has between 15 to 20 paople staying here all the time. Every person in my class and other coworkers staying there said the same thing. I guess if they acknowledged the problem, it would not annoy me so much. 2) The pool was very nice and relaxing, but the hot tub was broken several times while there. I would report it and then 2 days later it was still cold. I would report it again and they would have to go out and verifiy it, as apparently it was not believed or not accepted as not being warm. It was down probably 15% of the time during my 6 week stay there. I would reccommend this place to anyone, don't let my knit picking of the 2 things stop you unless they are your primary concerns. Mike

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel off the strip”
Reviews.Author: FMeister
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Staybridge Suites the night before dropping our rental car off at the airport for our flight home. It was perfect. Parking convenient. People friendly. Room was clean and comfortable. Nice (free) breakfast. We'd stayed on the strip before heading to Utah for a few days and Staybridge allowed us to get to the airport without the complications of the crowds and parking issues of the strip. Plus, it was less expensive. No casino, which didn't bother us, but they provide shuttles to get you to the gambling, shows, etc., if that's what you came for.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for the family in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: tankengine
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel in Las Vegas based on TripAdvisor review. So glad we did. This is the perfect base for Las Vegas especially if you have younger children. We had a lovely one bedroom suite, which had a full functioning kitchen. It also had a washing machine and dryer. Bonus. It's not located on the Strip, but just a short drive away. This makes it quieter. We made use of the free breakfast. A couple of hot choices and fruit and pastries. A couple of nights you can get a free meal. The interaction with staff were all positive and helpful. Would we use this again when in Vegas, a big yes.

Reviews.Title: “Very impressed”
Reviews.Author: Mountain300
Reviews.Content: Arrived 20 Jul 11 for 3 nights. On arrival we recieved a free upgrade, our room was 325. I have only used the staybridge suites in the UK so it was interesting to see what the differences would be, we were not dissapointed unlkie where we are now in Staybridge at Annaheim, LA. I agree with all the positive cooments made by other travellers. It is slightly out of town but when you have been on the strip all day this is welcomed break. Very modern, nice and quiet. Using the shuttle to the MGM is easy, a quick call to book your pick up when you have had enough. A taxi costs approx $15 dpending on where you get picke up from. Would definetly stay here again if we come back to LV. The highlight of our visit for me was the Belagio fountains at night, I could stand there for hours.

Reviews.Title: “Good deal for money”
Reviews.Author: NicsiBruxelles
Reviews.Content: An excellent choice for a calm place in Vegas. Rooms are ok, not top of the rock, but good enough for a family stay. I really appreciated breakfast served in real cups and dishes and not the standard throwaway. A touch of class that you find only in higher level hotels.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and want to go back!”
Reviews.Author: FlyingHirsch
Reviews.Content: Fantastic value. The suite was huge. Two bathrooms, one with shower/WC/basin and the other with bath/2 basins. The bath plug was, however, broken. When we reported this they sent someone up to fix it within 1/2 hour. Washing machine & tumbler in the room. Separate lounge area (open plan with the kitchen) with corner sofa, TV, and telephone. New kitchen with microwave, dishwasher, oven/hobs, freezer/fridge, plenty of cupboard space! Bedroom had a big bed and TV, side table and chair, wardrobe, telephone. We had a balcony with 2 chairs and table overlooking the pool. The pool was clean and big enough for a short swim. There were clean towels on each sun lounger. During the week there was a complimentary buffet dinner between 17:30 & 19:30; although they took time to refill the serving dishes and there wasn't a huge choice. Breakfast was included: a good range of choice and good quality. Located within walking distance of "the strip", they also offer a complimentary shuttle to the MGM Grand on the hour.

Reviews.Title: “not sure what all the fuss is about”
Reviews.Author: us_guy_in_uk
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 7 nights in Feb/Mar 2011, based on the TA reviews. Yes, the rooms are expansive (and not very expensive), but aren't all hotels like this in Vegas? Maybe not. Only stayed in Vegas on one other occassion, and that was the MGM Signature, so maybe I was spoiled on that trip. (Now that is a GREAT hotel!) Loads of room in the Staybridge Suites, great kitchen if you want to do your own meals. Breakfast is defintiely NOT great -- mediocre at best. It is away from the strip, so that's either a possitive or a negative. A good hike if you want some exercise. The free shuttle runs once an hour in both directions, but I did have an issue with the hotel on one occassion when I called ahead to schedule a shuttle coming back from the strip and, in spite of that, they left without me. 2 minute walk to the Crazy Horse III Club if you are into that. (Be careful of the VIP rooms there -- will cost you an arm and a leg!) Probably would not use the Staybridge Suites again -- like I said, nothing special here.

Reviews.Title: “Very quiet and will be back”
Reviews.Author: Miss_Icey
Reviews.Content: My first time to Las Vegas and I am happy that I booked my hotel reservations with StayBridge. It is a hotel that is away from the strip, but close enough that if you wanted to walk to MGM you could (about a 15-20 minute to MGM and a 10 min walk to the famous Welcome to Las Vegas sign). Free buffet style breakfast in the morning, you pay for dinner. Free shuttle that takes you to the strip, drop-off and pick-up at the MGM Grand and it runs every hour and the last shuttle is at 10pm or 11pm but you can catch a cab back or take the bus which drops you off 1 blck from the hotel at Mandalay Bay hotel. Shuttle does NOT pick you up from the airport, but it will drop you off at the airport when your stay is over. The hotel rooms are very clean, it is the size of a 1 bedroom apartment, I had a balcony that faced the strip, and I could see Mandalay Bay hotel and the lights from the strip at night. Flat screen television in the bedroom and living room area, huge bathroom with double sinks, full complete kitchen and the bonus was a washer and dryer that you could use for free but you had to pay for your own detergent which was fine for me. The only time I intereacted with the hotel staff is when I checked in, used the shuttle and when I went to have breakfast but it was a hi/bye type conversation, except with the shuttle driver, I forgot his name, but he drove the shuttle during the day and he was great when it came to a conversation. The pool area is great and the hotel gets extra points for the cabanas. When I went to the pool, it was only 5 of us out there and it was wonderful and very very peaceful. If you do not like noise and want to stay away from the strip, this is the hotel to stay at. The hotel really accomodates business professionals and a older mature crowd that wants to leave the partying, clubbing, loud noise etc. etc. at the strip and not bring it back to the hotel. Also pets are allowed at the hotel for a fee I believe.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: liveinasuitcase
Reviews.Content: All the good stuff people write about here is true. These were condos that when the market tanked that were turned into a hotel. I’d wanted to take the stainless refrigerator home. Washer/dryer in your room. It’s like staying in a nice, big vacation condo. It was very clean too. This was nicer than the Bellagio or Paris. It reminded me of the Signature at the MGM but nicer. There are even cabanas at the (uncrowded) pool. How likely are you to get a free cabana at the Strip hotels? If you are “over” the Strip but need to be close to it to go to work, you’ll really enjoy here. The Courtyard right next door is nice too - I’ve stayed there too. The first shuttle in the morning to the MGM can be a tad bit unreliable but not enough to cause you any problems as long as you stay on top of it.

Reviews.Title: “Business and Comfort”
Reviews.Author: CAgrand
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for business for one night. The rooms are not only roomy, but they provide many of the comforts of home with an extra sitting room as well as a kitchen. Modern and practical design make the visit a pleasure. The only negative was that there was not many choices for eating nearby. I was hard pressed to find a fast food restaurant within a few miles. They do provide phone numbers if you want to order in.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely suites, quiet location, great breakfasts, free shuttle”
Reviews.Author: TravellingAussieMum
Reviews.Content: Liked this hotel very much, found rooms to be spacious, clean and modern, with quality fittings and furniture. As others have noted, nowhere to eat in walking distance, or places to buy food to prepare in your room, but free shuttle to the Strip overcomes these problems. Breakfasts were fantastic, with fresh cooked hot items, lots of fruit and cereals, and eating in lovely dining/function area. Our kids slept on the sofabed in the sitting room, which was a good option for under twelves. Excellent swimming pool and helpful front desk staff. Suites were few and far between (and expensive!!!) on the Strip, so found this to be an excellent and low cost alternative, and we appreciated the quiet location at night. Laundry facilities in room a great bonus for travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Contemportary, Comfortable, Not so convenient”
Reviews.Author: johnjosephdonovan
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a number of colleagues in January 2011 (attending a Trade Show) and though it was a little far from the Exhibition we were attending, the location certainly made for a good nights sleep. The rooms are very ample, in the style of Staybridge Suites across the US and include a kitchen. Didn't get to use the swimming pool (it being January) but it looked like it was well kept. Front desk staff were very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay if you don't need to be on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: Cuterunninggirl
Reviews.Content: Beautiful suites, nice pool, huge variety of complimentary breakfast choices, and nice exercise room for a hotel. No complaints about this hotel located about a mile from the Strip. CLEAN & classy!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Place!”
Reviews.Author: BuyBuys
Reviews.Content: We are currently staying here on vacation for 2 nights with our kids and we love it! We have a king suite and it is perfect for us. We love that it has a washer and dryer, beautiful kitchen and a big sofa sleeper. We also love the dinner in the evenings. But, I think it's only a few days during the week. The breakfast is good for a hotel chain. We also are glad that there isn't a casino here so it's calm and peaceful. Highly recommend this place. But, don't tell anyone so you can have the pool area all to yourself! :)

Reviews.Title: “It's not a hotel, it's home”
Reviews.Author: rafa_friends
Reviews.Content: I just spent 6 weeks with my family there and we didn't want to leave. The suite has a large bedroom with direct access to the balcony. Bed is very comfortable. The living room is larger than the one in my own house with a large sofa which is also a double bed. There are two large LCD TVs, complete kitchen with even washing machine and dryer. Big tub and also a shower. Our room had views to the Strip and the highway but windows are soundproofed enough so noise it's not an issue. Besides, you could even go walking to Mandalay Bay so the Strip is really close. There is a shuttle service to the Strip and the airport though. Complimentary breakfast is good and they serve also a "social hour" dinner from tuesdays to thursdays offering pizzas, burgers, sandwiches, etc depending on the day. Great swimming pool including two hot water whirpools and quite well equipped gym. If I had to complain about anything, it would be the Internet connection speed which is topped at 0,5Mbps which is not enough for streaming video or skype videocalls but, at least the rate is stable. Without any doubt I'd come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great accomodation OFF the strip but accessible to the strip!”
Reviews.Author: Sedonamoon
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights before heading off to Zion & Bryce. There is a shuttle to the strip (it drops off/picks up @ MGM) but the shuttle's last trip is @ 10pm. You will need to grab a taxi after that. I would recommend getting a taxi from Mandalay Bay (the closest spot on the strip to the Staybridge) - it will run you about $10 (depending on what you tip). You could walk but it requires going over an expressway overpass & there is some construction going on in that area & the sidewalk is a bit broken up. It was VERY windy when we where there & the walk was not pleasant - hence the taxi ride the next night! The rooms were very clean, quiet, & spacious. The breakfast was fantastic with lots of choices for everyone - I really appreciated the fresh fruit, hot oatmeal, & yogurt. The staff was always very pleasant, professional, & helpful. I hope not to have to go back to Vegas again but if I do - I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel a little away from the action, EXCELLENT POOL.”
Reviews.Author: david77melb
Reviews.Content: We stayed recently for 5 days. its a new hotel hence everything is new. One of the best feature was the heated pool. We have stayed in a few hotels around the world including 5 star hotels. This pool was excellent, it beats most of the pools that we have seen. A large clean pool with a large pool for kids and 2 (yes 2 ) spa's. The best part was that it was empty most of the time and we had the pool to ourselves. The second best feature was in built washing machine and a dryer in the room "YES IN THE ROOM ". It had a full kitchen ( electric hotplate / oven / microwave/fridge/sink/granite bench top etc). Clean rooms. good service. Good Bfast. Kitchen staff good and helpful front reception. 3 computers (internet)with printers helped a lot ( unfortunately one got stolen while we were staying) but it still had 2 computers so no need to wait for your turn. It was away from the main strip which we knew and chose it due to the kids. If you have kids or don't want to stay in the main strip then this is a good hotel. You have to have a car to stay in this place as its a on the other side of the highway I15. But if you have come for the glamour and want to stay "where the action is" then this is not the place for you. It also has a reasonable sized fitness centre. David.

Reviews.Title: “Hair in shower, bathroom, stepped on a screwdriver left behind”
Reviews.Author: jpcrash
Reviews.Content: This hotel must have complained to tripadvisor to get my review removed but I'll try it again. This is a legitimate review. The location is a pretty good location and fairly new looking hotel. I'm a platinum member of Priority Club which is the top level in the IHG reward program system. I used my points for a free stay at this location and it did not meet overall expectations. There was hair in the shower and bathroom including poop particles on the back of the toilet. All the luggage carts squeaked and squealed very badly, like that annoying grocery cart. Stepped on a screwdriver left behind by maintenance or previous guest, either or would be pretty bad. Left the screwdriver with a note for housekeeping the next day. Left at 5AM and asked night employee about manager contact information and maybe a little bit of breakfast to go in the AM. He gave me the hotel phone number and told me to call later and employee wasn't able to even give me a banana to go. Other brand hotels are more then helpful when it comes to this sort of thing. I contacted guest relations (corporate) and they didn't help me very much either. They acted like my business wasn't of value, and I'm supposed to be considered on of the more valued guests because I am a platinum member. The hotel didn't refund my points used or even offer me a free night for a future stay to try and get my business back. I'll be back in the area in June but will be spending my week at another hotel. So much for $1500 of revenue going to staybridge.

Reviews.Title: “If I could live here I would - seriously...”
Reviews.Author: Travelin_Man069
Reviews.Content: Stayed here at a colleagues recommendation and they were spot on. This place wasn't a hotel room - it was more like a luxury apartment! Polished stone floors, kitchen was stocked with everything you would need to cook a full course meal including full size stainless appliances, all dishes and place settings, etc etc, full size dining room, washer and dryer. I just cant say enough. I'ved stayed at hotels all accross the US some five times as expensive as this one that don't even come close to this. The next time I'm in Vegas (and I will be) there is no question at all where I will be staying!

Reviews.Title: “Still the best value hotel in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: mitchellaustralia
Reviews.Content: This was my second family trip to Vegas in 2 years and we did not hesitate to book the Staybridge once again. The hotel is just off the strip at the south end but is only 5 mins away by car. The rooms are quiet and clean and do not not smell of smoke like all the ones on the strip. There is free parking and a free breakfast provided as well. On Tues to Thurs nights there is also a free light meal in the dining room. Access to the outlet malls at the North & South ends of Vegas is very easy from the hotel. I booked a few months in advance from Australia and asked for a strip view room. When I checked in a few hours early the friendly staff had my requested room ready. The room featured bedding for 4 people, huge bathroom, balcony, kitchen and most importantly for us a washer/dryer combo. This is still the best value hotel in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “May I move in! There should be a Staybride Suites in every city.”
Reviews.Author: Dejoma
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at a few Staybridge Suites on the East coast, but they have out done themselves in Las Vegas. Separate living and sleep area, two flat screen televisions, full kitchen, washer and dryer in the room and a balcony. Only paid $93 for the night. Only negative would be the distance away from the strip. I will definitely return if I'm ever in Las Vegas again.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, ideal for long stays”
Reviews.Author: trx899
Reviews.Content: Huge rooms, with kitchen, washing machine, dryer and terrace with a reasonable price

Reviews.Title: “It's All True”
Reviews.Author: kumtux
Reviews.Content: I selected this property based upon the Trip Advisor ratings. It is indeed a very remarkable hotel-- clean, quiet, large rooms designed for extended stay. But makes a great weekend vacation condo! I have no complaints and plan to stay here again next year. since my vacation is not focused on "The Strip." Rates are very competitive.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for business in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: SoCal_Visitor
Reviews.Content: New and polished. Condo-like rooms. Great staff. Good free breakfast and light dinner during the week. On the opposite side of the freeway from the strip, in an area of hotels and commercial buildings; not exactly pretty, but convenient. Not much within walking distance. A convenience store is a block away, but tends to be filled with semi-seedy people.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Staybridge! Beward of traffic/construction noise.”
Reviews.Author: frekwentflier
Reviews.Content: Simply put, this is one of the nicest hotels I've ever stayed at! I basically got a 1 bedroom apartment complete with full kitchen (stainless steel appliances!) within site of the Strip! Amazing! Everything about the hotel was perfect. It's new, the rooms are great, the check in & breakfast areas very nice, and very important, pretty fast wireless Internet! The room even had a balcony with a couple of chairs. Great for hanging out in the evening! The pool area was wonderful! They have both a hot and a cool tub jacuzzi. I took advantage of both as much as possible. The only downfall is the location is very close to I-15, so if you get a room facing that way, there will be a lot of traffic and construction noise. It was worth it to me to have a view of the Strip, but in hindsight, I wish I had asked for a quieter room. While I did not use it, they do offer a free shuttle to the MGM so you can get your gambling fix. From now on, unless my company doesn't give me a choice, this is the hotel I'll stay at in Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: suejessex
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights at the staybridge, very clean, very friendly staff, breakfast great. would recommend them perhaps next time have a car as we had to use taxi's a lot.

Reviews.Title: “Quality Staybridge”
Reviews.Author: JimCrall
Reviews.Content: The rooms were very nice, new, and they even had an oven and laundry machines right in the room. No smoking allowed in the rooms, but they had a balcony, so no worries. It's very close to the strip, but not too close, so the traffic was bearable. I stayed here for 3 weeks, and the staff was very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Las Vegas' hidden gem!”
Reviews.Author: DebbieT
Reviews.Content: This off-strip jewel is everything the other reviewers said it was. Clean clean clean, with housekeeping that I swear, I NEVER saw, but always did a wonderful job. One of my traveling partners said "We must be the only people on this floor, it's sooo quiet!" I related this to the desk clerk who laughed and said "Thank you for telling me that, we're actually at 100% capacity!" Completely furnished kitchens were extremely convenient to this budget-conscious trio of travelers. We were able to make a grocery stop which allowed us to save a ton of cash. Business center had three computers to use, never a wait. Fast connections. WiFi worked well, but the password changes every Sunday. Free breakfast was substantial, well-presented and tasty. We were present for one Tuesday night's fare as well, tacos and make-your-own burritos and cheese nachos. There was always something for the dieters in the crowd as well. Great stay. Great rooms. Great staff. Feel comfortable that you chose this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel I have stayed at.”
Reviews.Author: Colesmom
Reviews.Content: The staybridged suites in Las Vegas is a terrific hotel. Lobby, hallways, rooms are super clean. Our suite was huge. Could not hear any noise from hallways and very little from the road outside. Terrific breakfast in the morning and a small evening meal on thurs (also in tues. And weds. but we weren't here). Nice shuttle to the strip every hour until 10 pm. Would definitely stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, if you can find the entrance.”
Reviews.Author: CS6
Reviews.Content: Bit tricky to find the entrance, there are currently roadworks on Russell Road. Without a GPS I think you'd miss it to be honest, plus the signage on the road into the parking lot isn't the clearest either. This is a more upscale hotel than the average Staybridge Suites, the regular room I had was larger than at other Staybridge Suites I've stayed at. The bathroom is perfumed which I didn't like, reminded me of going into A&F at the mall. It is quiet with good sound insulation, so I couldn't hear I-15 at all even though it was so close. I could just hear aircraft landing at the airport (my room was east facing) but it wasn't loud enough to cause any issues with sleeping. Room had proper HDTV, which was nice, but the internet connection was pretty slow. The bed was the standard Holiday Inn set up, but I wasn't impressed with the pillows, I had a choice between hard and really hard, which was unusual. It is close to the strip but not on the strip, which is good, imv. If I go again I'll take my own pillow though.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: lf-Norway
Reviews.Content: Our second stay at this hotel! Will not consider another next time either. LOVE IT!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, safe, and quiet with good service”
Reviews.Author: travelerduo
Reviews.Content: The Staybridge Suites are new and gleamingly clean, and I found the hotel to be a welcome respite from the dark, smoky casinos and the noisy Strip with hucksters every few feet. The staff people are courteous and helpful, and there is a tiny shop that sells snacks and items travelers tend to forget to bring along. The complimentary breakfast is generous and varied, with fresh fruit, scrambled eggs or egg white, toast, bagels, waffles, cottage cheese, jalapenos, yogurt, milk, hot and cold cereal, juice, and hot beverages. Tuesday through Thursday evenings there is a free (!) small but adequate buffet. All of the complimentary meals are welcome, because it's not all that easy or inexpensive to get to the Strip or to anywhere else for meals. The free shuttle runs once an hour, but only to the MGM Grand, and taxi fares can add up. With some planning, you can work it out so that you're near a restaurant when you need to be. There is no free shuttle to the hotel from the airport, but the hotel shuttle is free from the hotel TO the airport. The fare from the airport was around $18, before the tip. The room was super clean and quiet. The shower head was plenty strong for good hair washing, and free Internet access was available. The kitchen was well stocked, with plates, mugs, glasses, and sliverware, plus a dishwasher, fridge, and microwave. It might even have had an oven. I was relieved to stay there and not on the strip, in spite of the inconvenience of going out for lunch. On the other hand, there are a couple of menus in the kitchenette for places you can order from. The prices are reasonable. It takes 45 minutes from the order to the delivery, possibly less.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Staybridge”
Reviews.Author: agentchris
Reviews.Content: As many others reviews have stated, the Staybridge Suites is a great non-Strip option in Vegas. It is just of Russell Street at the south end of the Strip, near Mandalay Bay. Having stayed on the Strip before in a large Casino Hotel (MGM Grand & Monte Carlo) it was nice not having the crowds and noise to deal with. Rooms at the Staybridge are great, morning breakfast was much better than average and best of all was the staff at the hotel. I found the internet connection to be better than many hotels and there is a nice business center and fitness room with high quality equipment in the hotel. I would recommend a car though it is not necessary with the shuttle service and cabs. Unless you need to or want to be on the Strip I would highly recommend the Staybridge Suites as a great alternative. Chris

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant experience and good value”
Reviews.Author: Fuzby
Reviews.Content: We selected this hotel based upon previous reviews, and were not disappointed. We are non-gamblers (coming to the area mostly for hiking), so weren't motivated to pay the higher prices for glitzy casino hotels, but wanted to do a bit of sightseeing and dining on the Strip, so didn't want to be too far away. Staybridge is within easy access (we could see all the lights from our room), and they have an hourly shuttle to the Strip if you don't want to rent a car. Our suite was quite spacious, with a well-appointed full kitchen, two large-screen TVs, and even a small washer and dryer. It overlooked a busy road, so there was traffic noise, but the heavy curtains helped block light and noise, and we slept well. Free wireless access and breakast were welcome perks. Nice & a good value!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: ResearcherMD
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect for us our recent trip to Las Vegas. We had a one bedroom suite with plenty of room to spread out. The kitchen enabled us to keep leftovers in the fridge and make coffee in the morning. When we wanted to relax, it gave us the space to not step on each other. I do recommend that you have a car and utilize the hotel's free parking. All the casinos have free self-parking, and a car gives you the flexibility to go off the strip as well, without paying for taxis. You cannot easily walk to the strip from the Staybridge, but we did not care because we had a car. The Staybridge deserves the rating it has on Trip Advisor, which is what got us to stay there to begin with. The staff is very friendly and helpful. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “This is one nice hotel deserving of its high rating”
Reviews.Author: oldgoat1
Reviews.Content: I often don't trust Tripadvisor reviews . I see good reviews for horrible hotels and wonder who wrote them. However, the Staybridge Suites in Las Vegas earns its good reviews honestly. My original stay in Vegas was supposed to be 6 days long at the Silverton. But after 2 days, I had enough of that place. I went to the Staybridge Suites in the morning, and asked to see a room. An assistant manager(Maria?) gave me the full blown tour of the hotel. I was treated like a special person. I couldn't wait to finish my vacation there. The desk person was nice, patient, and gave me probably one of the nicest rooms they had, even though I had no idea where the good locations were. She gave me a 5th floor corner room with an unbelievable view of the Strip and the mountains that ring Las Vegas. The breakfast each morning had everything anyone would want, and the evening reception Tueday through Thursday was pretty ample. Most of the larger suites have their own washer and dryer, but the studios don't. The Staybridge has washers and dryers that guests can use for free. That was a first for me. The shuttle ran almost hourly to the MGM, and you called for the shuttle to pick you up 15 minutes after the hour. There was also shuttle service to the airport. The location was great too. Two convenience stores within walking distance, and a small mall with a Whole Foods right around the corner south on the BLvd. Great great customer service and good location make this an outstanding choice for a Las Vegas stay.You won't be sorry.

Reviews.Title: “As good as the reviews say, if not better!”
Reviews.Author: seriocomic
Reviews.Content: We chose Staybridge Suites as an alternative for the Wynn Las Vegas for our remaining two nights in Vegas to go a little cheaper and a little quieter and we were so happy that the reviews here on TripAdviser were right. Clean and comfortable rooms, amazingly helpful and friendly staff, free Wifi and breakfast, free shuttle to the MGM and airport (awesome!). Read the other reviews and trust me when I say that if you don't mind being a mile off the strip then this is the place to stay. TIP: Check with desk staff before ordering delivery as the premises are subject to leaflet-droppers who sneak menus under your door.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: 2taxworkers
Reviews.Content: We just stayed there for 5 nights as we were attending a convention in Las Vegas. We were definitely surprised at how beautiful and spacious the room was. They offer a daily breakfast, which was not gourmet, but it hit the spot and was included in the price of the room. Also there was an evening light supper, from Tues through Thurs. The food was actually pretty good 2 of 3 of the nights. The pool and hot tubs were absolutely lovely, heated to the right temps. The staff could not have been nicer, throughout the entire place. One thing that bugged me - the air conditioning vent blew right on me when I was in bed. I wish they would have located that somewhere else!
