Other than that, it was a nice respite from the hustle and bustle of the strip. We will definitely stay here again, and recommend to others as well.

Reviews.Title: “Wow!”
Reviews.Author: shario
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately we only stayed one night at the Staybridge but it was so great we didn't want to leave! Where to begin...we were coming from a business conference so had a ton of laundry to do and it was wonderful to have a washer dryer in our room so we could just put the clothes in and leave instead of doing them at a laundromat or paying hotel laundry prices. The washer is a little tricky and took awhile to figure out (I think you push the lock icon-don't remember exactly what we did but it wasn't broken like we thought it was). There were two flat screen tvs in our suite. The kitchen was very well appointed, including a dishwasher. We even had a little balcony, not that there was anything to see except a few police actions. The only downside of this place is the location, which is off the Strip. It is best to have a car or you'll spend a bit of money on cabs. I heard there is a shuttle but we didn't notice it while we were there. There is a nice little fitness center, 24 hour market (where you purchase the detergent if you need it), free breakfast and internet. We could have gotten a cheaper hotel but after you add up all the extras, and no resort fee, this hotel was a bargain. It was great for us because we were going on a road trip the next day so we were able to avoid Strip traffic and get right on the highway. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay at the Staybridge”
Reviews.Author: mss09
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a 4 night stay and again what a fantastic hotel! So nice and quiet being away from the strip. We were able to check in early and the front desk even called later to see if everything was to our satisfaction.Our room was facing the east so enjoyed watching the sun rise in the morning and the lights of the hotels in the distance. Shuttle takes you to the MGM hourly and it is within a long walking distance. Rooms were big, nice kitchen area, big bathroom with great shower, comfortable bed. Breakfast in the morning was sufficient enough to start the day. Overall would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “As good as everyone says, and more”
Reviews.Author: BigSkySam
Reviews.Content: I booked a two night stay here in October 2010 based on the previous reviews, and I am very glad I did! I was able to get here within 10 minutes of leaving the airport. Checking in was nice and easy, and the young lady on the desk (I believe her name was Mercedes, apologies if I have that wrong) phoned to check everything was ok. Great service! The room itself was spacious, elegantly furnished and had a compact but perfectly equipped kitchen. The bed was comfortable, and I had no problems with my feet sticking over the edge (I'm 6'10'' and that happens a lot). The bathroom was as close to perfect as it gets, with a great shower that had excellent water pressure. Lots of towels of every different size too. My room was on the 5th floor, right by the sign on the freeway side. I could only hear the cars (And the planes taking off) with the door open, didn't have any problems hearing them when I fell asleep. Wireless Internet was good, no problems with signal strength or speed (I managed to Skype call without any issues). The car park was secure, with a regular security patrol on the grounds. There was also a little fitness centre, that had a good selection of cardio machines. On my first night I went to see the Blue Man Group at the Venetian (See separate review on that one). On the way back, I stopped at a Target and bought some supplies (As I was going to be driving up to Northern California a few days later). Consequently I came back with a few 12 packs of Mountain Dew, some water and other bags. I was able to make it to the lobby with these, but not much further. A hotel employee named Eduardo offered to help, and assisted me with carrying some of the items up to my room. He was extremely helpful, and even refused when I offered to tip him. I was very impressed by this! I checked out early on Saturday morning, and this was done promptly and efficiently by a very helpful employee (I believe her name was Myra). Overall this hotel is a real gem. Ok, its not on the Strip but its no less than 10 minutes away by car. In all honesty, its actually better that its away from all the mayhem. I'd describe the Las Vegas Strip as an assault on all your senses at once, so the Staybridge Suites is a little oasis of calm away from it all. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great relaxing hotel in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Colleentraveller
Reviews.Content: This has been our second time staying at Staybridge Suites in Vegas and once again it was a great experience. The hotel is very clean and quiet unless you are at the pool and there will be airplane noise. The rooms are big and very clean. The pool area was never busy and again clean. The staff was very pleasant and responded to needs very quickly and courtesiously. The location is great if you have a car since there is easy access to the I15 and the 215 highway. Stay here and you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and wonderful rooms”
Reviews.Author: luvtravel023
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for only one night of our 8 day trip to Vegas and Southern Utah. We arrived early for checkin and they had one of our rooms ready. Since we had to wait an additional hour for our second room they upgraded that room. (It was still before their published checkin time). Very nice rooms with balconies and beautiful kitchens. We had a problem with our TV in one room and with the Washer/Dryer in the other room. They were there immediately to fix the problems. Very nice staff! We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The only thing that could make this place perfect, if it was on strip”
Reviews.Author: Henderson_NevadaKen
Reviews.Content: If all Staybridge suites are like this one I wouldn't want to stay anywherre else Full Kitchen baloncy living room. free breakfast every morning Dinner tues thru thursday every week. a great tropical looking pool two hot tubs very relaxing only problem there wi fi was down most of the time. it didn't brother me. You would have to dirve if you wanted to see Las Vegas strip. Rates are very reasonable for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place I'm 21 brought three min...”
Reviews.Author: atm619
Reviews.Content: Very nice place I'm 21 brought three min pins they have the best pet policy, and they have comlientry breakfast Lund and dinner, room was seruper clean cool and bed was comfy pool is nice, not too busy place and if your looking for more of a party place maybe not, very happy stay for three nights if you gonna be more than that this is cool cause it's like a condo,

Reviews.Title: “Simply perfect and beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: Raffasworld
Reviews.Content: There are so many pros for this hotel and I can't still believe why people should go to any hotels on the Strip! we booked a king guestroom with a balcony and the room...is not exactly a room but an apartment of medium size. huge living room with the kitchen, beautiful bedroom and huge bathroom. everything is super clean too. the balcony is large and very nice if you like to breath some fresh hair at night. our room was facing the big road and the Las vegas skyline. Even facing the road, the room is very well isolated and no noises at all inside. Check in was fast and smooth, breakfast is very good, simple but extremely fresh. The staff was very kind, we asked for a late check out at 3pm and they said right away yes at no charge! it's really a gem and the best part is the pool area... it closes at midnight and it's very clean and quite. Any "cons": very hard to find, maybe for this hotel you have to rent a car (we did and parking is for free...). I heard the hotel has a shuttle that can bring you to the Strip but I don't know better for this service.

Reviews.Title: “Don't overlook Staybridge Suites”
Reviews.Author: TimboCambridgeshire
Reviews.Content: Whilst this hotel is off the strip, the free shuttle bus, the fabulous rooms and the deserted pool made the hotel perfect for our stay. There is a little aircraft noise and the smell of aviation fuel (subject to wind direction) although this must be consistent with other hotels this end of the strip. If you want to return to some peace at the end of your hectic 'Vegas' day you couldn't fail to find this hotel just the job!

Reviews.Title: “Out if the way but nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: sheridan_10
Reviews.Content: The only one issue with the hotel was its distance from the main strip. But with shuttle buses running regularly it wasnt really a problem. The rooms were lovely, big and very clean. The only one issue we had was that when the prepared their complimentary meals, there were no vegetarian options, meaning we had to do without. Apart from that the stay was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant like having your own hotel”
Reviews.Author: dannma
Reviews.Content: Just spent the last 3 days staying at this hotel and really am struggling to find anything wrong with other than minor detail that the shuttle bus stops operating at 10.15pm which in Las Vegas is really early. As other people have said the hotel is out of the hustle and bustle of the strip and situated on the Dean Martin Strip which allows you to easily get from one of the strip to the other without much traffic. The rooms are fantastic and look like they have just been remodelled. Everywhere is clean and tidy. The staff are the most helpful we could have come across and the breakfast is great. Pool is lovely and warm and throughout our stay most times had the pool to ourselves. If you want lots of people, noise and traffic don't stay here. If you want calm relaxing environment with hourly complimentary bus into MGM stay here. Please don't tell too many other people about our secret gem.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely suites in quiet location just off the Strip.”
Reviews.Author: TwoTripsters
Reviews.Content: Booked here because of mostly excellent reviews on tripadvisor and we wanted a bit of peace and quiet away from the Strip. We certainly were not disappointed in any way. From the moment we entered the lobby we were treated very well by the courteous and helpful staff. Even though we were early, our excellent suites were ready for us. Everything was of the highest quality and for our convenience. After reading a recent negative review about the noise from the nearby airport, we completely disagree with what was said. Our suite faced the airport and yes, if we were on the balcony in the 106 degrees temperature then, we could hear the planes and watch them as they took off. But they were not very loud at all. When doors and windows were closed we barely heard a thing from outside, including the nearby roads and all slept really well. The hotel serves a daily complementary breakfast which is varied and offers a good choice. Also on Tues, Wed and Thurs evening a light buffet which is also complementary is available.. A regular shuttle service is available to the Strip. We definitely would recommend these suites to anyone and only wish there were many more others around the USA, with as good value and service as these.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel! Highly Recommend.”
Reviews.Author: Parklandmom
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on August 7th with my husband and teenage daughter. In my opinion, it earns its rating as #2 hotel in Vegas. The rooms were nicely done and very spacious. Full kitchen, king size bed, balcony. This is a great hotel if you do not want to stay directly on the strip. They have shuttle service, or you can rent a car or get a cab to whereever you want to go. I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and convenient to Strip”
Reviews.Author: ttraveling
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night with children ages 10 and 12. The one bedroom suite was very spacious. Not sure if the kids would have been comfortable for more than a couple nights on the sofa bed but it was fine for our short stay. Our balcony overlooked the road but street noise was not a problem for sleeping. Free breakfast is fine with 2 hot entrees, waffle station, cereal, bagels/toast. Staff was very friendly and the pool was adequate and not at all crowded mid-day. Not much within walking distance; we had a rental car so did not use the shuttle. I recommend this hotel for those looking for a quieter place off the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Room with All the Amenities Right Off the Strip”
Reviews.Author: FITfalcon
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for about 30 days and it was, hands down, the nicest room I have seen for less than $100 per day. I spend approximately 48 weeks/year traveling for business. For a long term stay I haven't seen a better room than this in a chain hotel. The room has everything you can possibly want, including a full kitchen with new stainless appliances and a washer/dryer. The bed was great and the curtains were very thick. I worked night shift (7pm-7am) and slept during the day. I never woke up from noise inside or outside the hotel. Pretty good considering the airport about a mile away. They also have an excellent fitness center. The free breakfast buffet was a bit better than par. The location was excellent; a 5 minute ride to the strip, airport and any shopping/restaurant. I wish every place I went had a hotel like this one

Reviews.Title: “Perfect but rent a car”
Reviews.Author: NatashaLitmanen
Reviews.Content: The services, the room, the staff and the meal was great. Recomended but If you want to go to this hotel you need to rent a car... simply. It's not so near of the center.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific”
Reviews.Author: nederlandse_toerist
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in August last year. This hotel is simply perfect: very pleasant and comfortable, remarkably friendly staff, great swimming pool. Excellent location, away from the frenzy on The Strip (which is 5 or at most 10 minutes by car) and also not very far from the airport. Good enough breakfast buffet. Night shop at the gas station a little further on (couple of minutes walk). Gym with a view on casino hotels on The Strip. At the check-in we got a (unasked-for) upgrade to a stunning room with separate bedroom (incl. a big flatscreen), huge bathroom, fully-equiped kitchen, dishwasher, and even a washing machine and dryer. We only payed about 130 dollar per night (incl. taxes and breakfast). In fact, it was an apartment in which one could easily stay a couple of weeks. We were overwhelmed by it's luxury. Extremely agreeable.

Reviews.Title: “Just beautiful”
Reviews.Author: jollyies
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Staybridge was just perfect. We were very tired and grumpy when we got there from the long drive from LA and I was dissapointed that our room doesn't have a washing machine.(at that time i didn't do too much shopping and I had no clean clothes left). Anyway, the nice lady downstairs gave us a great upgrade to a nice big suit with kitchen, big bathroom, lounge room with a second tv(first big tv being in the bedroom). I need to mention that the room had a balcony where you could enjoy either the view of the strip or the view of the pool. I prefer the view of pool (and the montains). We spend one night in a room with the strip view and we had to move because the AC didn t work to my husband expectation(i didn't agree with that anyway). There is a shuttle that takes you to the strip, nice breakfast(we didn't wake up for it too much for it though). If I will ever go back there I will go at Staybridge 100%. Oh, I forgot to say: the beds are sooooo confortable.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: salbot
Reviews.Content: This hotel is brilliant! I think it is the best hotel I have stayed in! The rooms are amazing - massive with kitchens and big bathrooms and 2 TVs. Very clean and staff were really nice. The breakfasts were good too. It was also nice that the hotel didn't have a casino in it! There was free internet and wifi and a pool which was never busy. They provide a free shuttle bus every hour to the strip which takes about 5 minutes. They also pick you up from the strip and bring you back if it was before 10pm. We returned later than that every night so we just got the deuce bus to Mandalay Bay hotel - last stop for the bus and then walked to the hotel which took about 15 mins. This walk was fine at night as it wasn't blazing hot! I would definitely stay here again and recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Best stay for off the strip lodging.”
Reviews.Author: AE_Man76
Reviews.Content: We always use Holiday Inn hotels to accrue points and was tickled to find this nice, new hotel off the strip but close enough to see everything. We were upgraded to a balcony room with a view of the mountains and the strip. The hotel ran a shuttle at the top of each hour to MGM, and a taxi to Mandalay Bay was only about $10-12. On Thursday, we had free soup and salad and each day offered a great breakfast. My wife and I would take some bagels and peanut butter or such to our rooms and enjoy a "free lunch" as well. The pool was great and rarely used by others. The rooms were very spacious and nicely done. Cleaning service each day was good. Also, a great fitness center! Best choice we made in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Impressed, highly recommended, would stay again & again”
Reviews.Author: mumdadand2kids4
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic place. There were 4 of us, 2 adults, 2 young children and it was quite spacious. The rooms were of high quality, very clean and modern. The kitchen was of high quality, with all you need to get by. Didn't cook there, just made sandwiches, warmed milk, snacks etc Bathroom was really spacious and clean. It was so easy staying there. We had a washer/dryer in our room which was priceless when our little one required a change of clothes so often! The staff were very friendly, but service was very slow when we requested linens for the sofa bed on our first night (after almost 18 hours of travelling, 15hours in the air)- it took them almost 1 hour to bring up the linens. High speed internet was reliable and the business center was great, the gym looked fancy too-wish I had time to use it! Included breakfast was convenient-although basic, but more than enough for a simple breakfast. Parking was easy, with multiple access to the building from different areas (so every parking spot was a good one). Impressed, highly recommended, would stay again & again

Reviews.Title: “Still a wonderful choice for off-strip stay”
Reviews.Author: cag18
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I just returned from an extended stay in Las Vegas at the Staybridge. We had visited for a couple of nights last June and decided to return this year, to really spend more time in LV to enjoy the weather and local entertainment. The suites are spacious and very well presented. The kitchens have everything you need, and as long as you are not in one of the small studios (dont waste your time in them) you will also have in-suite laundry facilities. We chose the king-bed suite again, and had more than enough space. All very clean. Excellent value. The swimming pool is a very nice size, and is never busy. At its busiest during our stay we shared the pool area with 5 other people. About 495 less than if we had been staying at the Bellagio. The hottubs are a nice i treat for after sunset. The hotel has ample parking right outside, and the shuttle bus will take you to the strip at the top of the hour. Driving to the strip is also very easy, and self-parking at any of the bigger hotel/casinos was always very easy. Taxi rides back to the hotel should not set you back more than about $15. Breakfast does the trick, with plenty on offer, and on Tue/Wed/Thur you can also pickup a complimentary evening meal down in the breakfast room/lounge. We were treated to some nice BBQ treats one evening. Perfect pre-gambling snack! Perhaps the best thing going for the Staybridge LV is the wonderful service provided by the very willing staff. From reception through house-keeping, we were always greeted by smiles and a friendly hello. Everybody seemed to take pride in their job, and helps keep it running very smoothly. I was very happy to find the ever helpful Eduardo still working there. I am very pleased to say that this hotel is still as great as we remembered from 2009. Yes, a pool view room does also result in quite a bit of noise from planes when they take off towards the west from McCarran, and yes I am sure the air conditioning in the rooms could be a little quieter (tip: cool the room well before bedtime and then turn it off for the night), but regardless, I would always look to stay here if I was wanting to be just a short ride away from the strip. If the glamour (and chaos) of staying on the strip does not appeal to you, then I suggest you check out the Staybridge Suites on Dean Martin Drive. C.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel rooms and breakast excellent shuttle service to stip very poor”
Reviews.Author: bluenose6
Reviews.Content: The good news the hotel ..quality size of rooms fatastic,the breakfast could not be faulted the staff keep everything very clean ,ok you say whats the problem.well its this booked from the UK for seven nights the shuttle service was a very important factor as the Hotel is off the strip and dont take any notice of anyone who tells you can walk into the strip you gave to cross a busy motorway three times I did once,you take your life in your hands ,the Staybridge do not encourage you to use the Shuttle sevice it does not run on the hour as advertisedyou request it 9times out of ten its not available....... whilst on the other hand there are two marriott and one holiday inn right opposite who do run on the hour every hour until midnight ...my advice to anyone coming from the UK check out the Marriott and Holiday inn on DEAN MARTIN DRIVE,if a shuttle service is an important factor in booking the Staybrige Suites

Reviews.Title: “Close to the airport, good value”
Reviews.Author: Boldizsar
Reviews.Content: We arrived late evening from Europe and went to the national parks early morning therefore we needed a hotel close to the airport. It was a 10 minute drive. It is not far from the strip either, we could see Luxor and Mandalay Bay from our window. Of course it is too far from anything to walk but very convenient to go to the highways. The building is together with two similar inns I think you can find a room without reservation. The rooms are clean, look new, spacious with a full kitchen, bed was comfortable, no noise from the street. Wifi was free. Our only problem was that the breakfast started too late at 7.30. It is OK if you gamled the whole night but not if you start your tour early. We would not stay here for a Las Vegas experience but for one night it is a very good choice and value.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel just off the strip! Highly Reccomended!”
Reviews.Author: DC413
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay here for our first trip to Vegas based on the recommendations from trip advisor and that I was able to get some free reward nights. We were not disappointed. All the staff was extremely helpful and nice. We arrived at 11:00am, and although our room was not cleaned, they said they would start on it right away and it would be done in an hour. We came back an hour later, and the room was ready as promised, 3 hours before check in time! There's a lot to like about this place. As mentioned before, all the staff were extremely helpful and nice. The rooms are suite style and very spacious, clean and contemporary. The full fridge and washer/dryer came in handy. The free breakfast was also wonderful, with both hot and cold choices. Not having to pay for breakfast every morning can be a big money saver. The hotel also has a shuttle that runs to the MGM every hour until 10pm. We used it almost every day. The hotel is basically across I-15 from Mandalay, and while not on the strip, it is definitely walkable if you don't mind walking a couple miles. We walked home from the strip every night with no problems. The pool area is also very nice, and doesn't have the party scene of most of the large hotel/casino pools. With 2 hot tubs, and large swimming pool, and cabanas, it was easy to relax and enjoy the quiet pool atmosphere. Perfect for escaping the craziness of the strip. The excercise room was also very large and well equipped with dumbells, weight machines, treadmills, stair steppers and a strip view. There really isn't anything to dislike about this hotel. I'd recommend a pool view room if you plan to spend time on the balcony though, as the balconies on the strip view rooms are noisy due to adjacent I-15 (the noise was not an issue inside the room however), and the view is of the backside of the strip so not that impressive. Staybridge really is the perfect place to stay if you want to relax away from the casino hotels and craziness of the strip while still not being too far removed from the action.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic hotel away from The Strip”
Reviews.Author: Wolin
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay. The staff are great, our suite was very clean and spacious; it had a balcony with table and chairs, washer and dryer and a full kitchen. This was topped off by a big comfy bed. Breakfast was really good; eggs, toast, fruit salad, juice ++. The free shuttle to The Strip ran every hour. I recommend this for any stay of more than a few days.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Value”
Reviews.Author: Sicall
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel due to the reports on this page and i wasnt dissapointed. Not only are the rooms, spacious and beautifully appointed the facilities are excellent as well. The pool area is very well designed and the dining room that serves breakfast in the morning is a refreshing change from most American chain hotels. The staff were very friendly and helpful throughout our stay. The location is easy to get to from the freeway and the strip. If you want somewhere that doesnt have a slot machine in sight this hotel comes highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Looking for a great stay while in Vegas?”
Reviews.Author: LakeshoreLady
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a week at the Staybridge Suites and couldn't be happier. I use Trip Advisor for all of our travels and chose this hotel because of the great reviews. This is definitely THE place for extended stays while in the Vegas area. The hotel is situated only minutes from The Strip, but offers travelers a quiter, more restful place to enjoy their vacation. Our suite wa a one-bedroom, with living room, dining room, kitchen and bathroom - all very nicely furnished and immaculately clean! The suite offers nice amenities, such as a balcony with table and chairs, upgraded toiletries in the bathroom, 2 flat screen TVs, free wireless, in-room washer and dryer, icemaker ( a must!), dishwasher, Whirlpool stainless appliances, and ample space to move about. The staff is both accommodating and cordial - very attentive to the traveler's needs. The free breakfast buffet includes scrambled eggs, bacon, sausage, oatmeal, dry cereal, toast, muffins, bagels, cheese omelets, biscuits and gravy, waffles with strawberrirs and cream, juices, coffee, a variety of milk - including soy, and all the trimmings. On Tuesday through Thursday nights, a complimentary light supper is also offered...this included Taco & Nacho night, Soup & Salad night and Pasta (with salad and garlic bread) night. And it actually tasted good! I highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a good value, comfortable accommodations, and quick and easy access to The Strip! The hotel does offer a shuttle to MGM Grand, which is a great starting point for visiting The Strip. No worries about booking your stay here - you won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Best Non Strip hotel by far”
Reviews.Author: Drizz1129
Reviews.Content: This place is amazing! The rooms are top quality - clean, modern, fresh, and with a full kitchen too! I asked for and received a studio suite facing the strip - the view was amazing at night with all the lights from the strip. We even had a lovely balcony that was great to sit on after a long day on the strip. The pool and Jacuzzi area was great as well, never over crowded like the pools on the strip, and such beautiful landscaping and facilities. The best part had to be the complementary breakfast and evening dinners. Such a money saver! If you were here with a family, it would be perfect. The breakfast was always fresh and each day they had new options. Dinners were tasty, but I would not call them gourmet. Still, it’s all free! They also had a free shuttle going to and from the strip. I would go back to this property in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL BUT THE STAFF ISN'T WHAT IT USED TO BE”
Reviews.Author: LasVegasFan007
Reviews.Content: This is a pretty decent hotel. We stayed at this hotel for 4 months in 2009 and we are back for at least 2 months in 2010. Since 2009, the hotel had a 95% staff turnover. All the people we liked from last year are gone. The big difference this year is that the hotel has become less guest friendly. The price of the room includes daily breakfast and a light dinner on Tuesday, Wednesday and Thursday. In terms of dinner they seem to run out of things, even if you arrive at a reasonable time. Last night was Pasta Night and they were out of tomato sauce about 1/2 hour after dinner started. How expensive is plain tomato sauce? Last year the hotel provided non-stop soft drinks and coffee. This year, they only offer coffee during breakfast and soft drinks from 5:30 PM to 7:30 PM. And usually they are out of ice. What I find particularly annoying is that housekeeping pays NO attention to the DO NOT DISTURB sign! (Don't even bother to put it up)!!! With the Do Not Disturb sign on the door, they start banging on the door early on a Sunday Morning.and try to get in if you don't open the door in 3 seconds! You say no to them, and they again come back a short while later and ignore the do not disturb sign. Not a very pleasant situation after a late Saturday Night in Las Vegas. These may not be earth shattering problems but the culture of the hotel is changing but not for the better. My other complaint is that this hotel has the slowest Internet that I have ever experienced. It is virtually impossible to watch anything on Youtube or any other online video. If you want to do more than just browse and check your emails, then you will not be happy with this Internet. It is very slow, especially during peak hours. Mind you, the hotel doesn't charge extra for it. Still, as everybody mentions, the rooms are very nice. The location is pretty good, near I15 and just south of Mandalay Bay. If you need to get somewhere across town, you can get there quite quickly. This is a very nice hotel and I am hoping that it doesn't continue to go downhill. However, last year I gave the hotel 5 Stars Across the board!

Reviews.Title: “Nice time in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Salemduckfan
Reviews.Content: If you want a place off the strip this new hotel is great. I stay at Staybridge for business so I know the brand. They have a shuttle that takes you to the MGM and picks up too.

Reviews.Title: “This is a fabulous place to stay !”
Reviews.Author: liketravelCanada
Reviews.Content: Myself and two friends stayed in one of the larger suites for one week.. last Nov. The kitchen was amazing, with all new & full size , high end appliances and lots of utensils etc. The bed was massive and super comfortable.. we lived liked queens and a king.. for the week ! Large sized Flat screen TV in living and bedroom. We did not notice any noise at all.. from planes or traffic. Our suite was located above the pool etc.. area. It was an excellent value and very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Best Staybridge Suites I have stayed at. Great location but comes with some traffic and airport noise.”
Reviews.Author: vamaddog
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed here for three nights. We booked a One Bedroom Suite and it was awsome. Very roomy, upgraded kitchen with granet counters, in room laundry, a split bathroom area with one half open to the bedroom area having the tub and double vanity and the closed room having another vanity toilet and shower. Decorating was very nice with upscale furnishings and a comfortable bed. Two large flat screen TV's. A full size dining room table for four. Bedroom could be closed off from the living area with large pocket doors. The property is adjacent to I-15 and near the airport which is great for easy access. The down side is the traffic and airport noise. With the doors closed we did not hear the noise, but if you sit on the patio or leave the doors open you will hear it, same is true for the pool area. Lots of free parking. The two issues we grumbled a little about were a shower head that would not tilt down enough for a normal height person. NBA players would find it perfect, others not. This would be an easy fix for the maintenance folks after a trip to Lowes or Home Depot for a different angled connector. The other issue was that the temperature in the breakfast area was cold each day, probably 65 degrees. They need to better balance that system. We plan to stay here again. It is a pleasant break from the hectic and smoky properties on the Strip. Best enjoyed if you bring your car or rent one. Free shuttle is nice, but limited in schedule and routes.

Reviews.Title: “all the comforts of home.”
Reviews.Author: TheAlexanders205
Reviews.Content: What can I say.... this is by far the best Staybridge in their system that I have stayed in. large comfortable room. great breakfast great fitness room shuttle to MGM. quite nice pool area. nothing bad.... go to the strip and then back to the Staybridge and wind down.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms”
Reviews.Author: iomboi
Reviews.Content: Really nice hotel, would definately stay again. Can get quite pricey back and forth to the strip although there is a free shuttle provided only found this out when checking out, was not informed at check in but oh well, for all the ppl who do get taxi's its about 15 dollar including tip to strip one way. rooms are big and airy well there are suites there good for the value. staff seemed a bit slow but they were some competent ones, overall a nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of this hotel if you don't like jet blast and noise every 45 seconds!”
Reviews.Author: RiverRogue
Reviews.Content: This hotel would be the best in town except for the fact that is right on the runway so the jet blast literally shakes the rooms. And, there are major roads and highways within feet of the hotel on the other side. Planes took off every minute or so all night long. The rooms are stunningly beautiful with a large tub, nice kitchen, suite layout with large flat screen televisions etc.. And, the hotel has a lovely pool and spa. BUT, WHAT GOOD IS ANY HOTEL IF YOU CAN'T SLEEP EVEN WITH EARPLUGS IN? I would only rate this hotel high for people used to living right on a freeway.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic for the price!”
Reviews.Author: lost_travelers
Reviews.Content: Booked the deluxe suite in May 2009 for New Years 2010. Got a fantastic rate since it was booked early and paid in full; stayed 6 nights. Our goal was to have New Years on Fremont Street, which was AWESOME! then go rock climbing at Red Rock National Conservation Area for the rest of the time. We had a great time. Pros: Breakfast included: waffles, eggs, bacon, biscuits/gravy, cereals, fruit, yogurt, coffee, juice Dinner included (Tues-Thurs): never made it to these since we were on the strip those nights Shuttle service to MGM (didn't use this either, easier with own vehicle) Big kitchen and living area Comfortable huge bed Corner couch in living room with pullout bed (not so comfy though) Big screen TV in living room and master bedroom Friendly staff who tried to be helpful Apparently there's cocktail nights, but we never made it to those either. Very clean, modernized suites Non-smoking hotel Away from the strip Washer and dryer Fitness Center 24hrs Cons Shower sometimes didn't get hot enough for my liking Hot tubs outside were never hot. We told the front desk on day 1 who said maintenance would work on it. The next day neither hottub was warm, told front desk again who said they were broken and maintenance was trying to fix them. Never did get a chance to soak in a hottub. Also the pool is cold in January since it isn't heated!

Reviews.Title: “I can see why this is rated #1 in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Lattenut
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 5 day stay in Vegas at Staybridge Suites. We wanted something with a kitchen and off the strip. This place was perfect. You can see the strip but not hear the strip. The rooms are large, the bed is comfy and the kitchen has everything you could need. Bonus - not a slot machine in sight! Free breakfast is blah, but other than that - our stay was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “WOW, The Reviws are Right”
Reviews.Author: llsee
Reviews.Content: The wife and I recently visited Vegas to celebrate our 40th anniversary. Our daughter and her husband flew in to join us. Based on the reviews here on Tripadvisor, we decided to both book a suite at the Staybridge. All I can say is the reviews are correct. The hotel is extremely nice, not far off the strip, and the suite we had was beautiful. Nicely decorated, it was huge. There was a full kitchen (with stainless appliances), a dining area , large corner sofa that also turned into a sleeper, a separate bedroom, Flat screen TVs in both the living and bed rooms, a tub, dual sinks, and a separate room with a walk-in shower, sink and toilet. This suite was larger than several apartments we have lived in. All this for less than a standard room at most of the casino hotels. Everything was clean and in excellent shape, and even though they said that they only cleaned the rooms on the weekend by request, they straightened up our room and provided clean towels even though we did not request it. The hotel is only 2 blocks away from the Mandalay Bay, was convenient to roads that allowed for easy access to the big casinos. Although they have a shuttle, you will definitely appreciate having a car at this hotel. With its location, it was easy to access the casinos on the East side of the strip and avoid having to drive on the strip. Granted, there is no room service or in-hotel restaurant, however, we wanted to eat at several of the well known chef's restaurants. The no-smoking building, and free breakfast along with the well-appointed large suites, made this a reasonable compromise for the price. Ok, I had a couple of quibbles. When we arrived at about 2:30 in the afternoon, the desk clerk told us he could not check us in before 3:00 PM. We said our daughter had called and said she was already there. We asked him to check and he said that no one was there by that name. So, we called her cell phone and she had indeed already checked in and was in a suite on the 3rd floor. We decided that the 4 of us would just go get a late lunch. And when we returned about 5:30 PM, the manager apologized profusely for the confusion earlier and said the clerk was new. In my book though, it was no-harm, no-foul. One other small quibble is that I thought the shower head was rather oddly placed in the walk-in shower. Those are just quibbles, and our 3 night stay was truly enjoyable and very pleasant. We will definitely stay here on our next visit to Vega$.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect room in a wonderfull hotel at a quiet place”
Reviews.Author: Minfra
Reviews.Content: The hotel is not at the Strip but about 10min. by car away from the MGM building at the Strip. Just at the other side of highway 15. A quiet spot to relax from the dazzle and razzle of crazy Las Vegas. There is a free shuttle that brings you to the strip and take you back to the hotel at the time that you agree with the frinedly drivers. The suites are grand: living room, sleeping room, bathroom and a fully equiped kitchen. There is even with a washing machine. The hotel has a large swimming pool and whirl pools. During our stay in September, we were only with less than 10 persons in the pool late afternoon. Much more preferred than the colossal hotels at the Strip where you are with hundreds at breakfeast and in the swimming pool.

Reviews.Title: “All great except the Internet connection”
Reviews.Author: SoCalFam99
Reviews.Content: I had stayed there on a business trip a few months ago, based upon the great reviews in TripAdvisor. On that trip, the poolside music went on at 3:00 AM accidentally, and it took the front desk 20 minutes to get it turned off. My room had a pool view and the music woke me. The next morning when I told the staff that I had to get up early, and was not prepared for my meeting due to the middle-of-the-night pool noise, they refunded the room charge for the night. The suites are amazing. They are like new apartments. I brought the wife and kids 11/23-11/25 and the only complaint was that the Internet speed in our room was slow at all times of day, wired and wireless, on 2 different laptops. Beside that, everything was perfect. The breakfast, the staff, the pool/jacuzzi, and so on. We now have a new Las Vegas home.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel off strip”
Reviews.Author: mss09
Reviews.Content: We selected this hotel based on reviews and were not disappointed! We thought about staying on the strip, but after booking this hotel we're so glad we didn't. The hotel has an hourly shuttle to MGM and that worked great for us.The room was great, had a kitchen, big shower, king size bed. The breakfast in the morning was sufficient, saved us from spending more money on food, business center was handy for printing out our boarding passes, staff was great, always very helpful. Would definitely stay here again if we come back to Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Superb in every way”
Reviews.Author: phil0264
Reviews.Content: Fantastic suite, good breaky, helpful staff. Location was just behind the strip, behind the Mandalay. A free mini-bus runs every hour from the suites to the MGM and back again. We used this as a base for our wedding, and can't rate it high enough. Yes we could have stayed on the strip, but there you get just a room for the same price, and you're stuck there in the midst of everything, all the time. This place is so handy and just a bit away, but so close to the airport, etc. And free wifi aswell.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: redomaha
Reviews.Content: Staybridge suites was a very nice hotel for the price. The rooms are modern and clean and quiet if you are not toward the road. We did have a problem upon check in that we were told they were overbooked and they would put us elsewhere. But he proceeded to check in the people that came after us. Upon calling our travel company they were suddenly able to accomadate us. I would recommend this hotel in spite of our problem

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous rooms, fabulous staff - but not ideal location”
Reviews.Author: LizzieD79
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed at Staybridge for 3 nights during our North American holiday. The room itself was absolutely beautiful and huge. There are full kitchen and laundry facilities in the room, a dining area, a TV area (with a huge couch), a large bedroom, and 2 bathroom areas (one with a large bath, and another with toilet and shower). Staff were friendly and extremely helpful. On our checkout day we nearly missed our flight, and they went out of their way to get us to the airport quickly in their complimentary shuttle. However, we felt that this was not the most convenient place to stay in order to explore the strip. While there was a shuttle running between the hotel and the strip, this only ran every hour, and the final bus came back from Vegas at around 10pm. This didn't make a lot of sense to us considering that Vegas is a city that most people would want to be exploring at night. Getting back to the hotel late at night was difficult because taxi drivers did not seem to have heard of this hotel. We also found that we had very little hot water in our room, which was quite frustrating when wanting to unwind with a nice shower or bath after a long day. I would recommend this hotel if you want somewhere luxuriously large to stay in Vegas that is away from the strip itself, but don't plan to be in Vegas after 10pm. However, would recommend staying somewhere on the strip if you plan to be out later than that - it would be a lot easier.

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best place to stay in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: WirralStuart
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Staybridge for 2 nights before departing on a motorcycle road trip around the Grand Canyon, we returned for a third night before flying back to thr UK. The rooms are very large and spotlessly clean, fridge, sink, full size dish washer, coffee machine, bed the size of a planet and a really good bathroom. Lovely swimming pool, which unfortunately we didn't get to use. Free hourly shuttle to the MGM Grand and returning from the MGM at 15 minutes past the hour, last shuttle at 22:15 which might restrict some people, but a taxi is only about $15, if you can find a taxi driver who knows where the Staybridge is! Staff were very helpful, we were able to leave our large suitcase at the hotel while we were on our road trip. 24 hour convenience shop stocked with most essentials. Aboslutely made our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations and then some.”
Reviews.Author: limo77
Reviews.Content: This hotel had great reviews and did not disappoint. Though I had forgotten exactly which amenities were offered, we were happily surprised when we walked into our room. The lobby was beautiful, but we have seen hotels with great lobby areas with old, boring rooms in disrepair. We were there for our daughters wedding, and had 12 people over between the wedding and reception and there was room for more:) Full kitchen with regular sized oven, stainless steel dishwasher and full sized fridge. Microwave, toaster, coffemaker, dishes, pots, pans, dishsoap, paper towels, salt, pepper, micropopcorn, coffee, too much to mention. A closet with stackable washer/dryer, nice dining table for 4, larger sofa with one side you can lay down on? can't remember what they are called. Balcony with table and two chairs. Nice large picture window in living room area, coffee table, larger flat screen t.v. in wall unit. Bedroom had king bed, with tons of pillows. There was a little placard saying there were feather down pillows in a closet if that was your preference. The bedroom had a door to the balcony as well. Two nightstands, and dresser with another flat screen t.v. A clothes closet in the bedroom. Ironing board and iron. Bathroom: nice larger tub/shower with granite type tile on floor. Beautiful vanity area with 2 sinks and mirrors. Nice lighting, not flourescent. Large bathroom, that could be accessed from main living area and bedroom. We have never been in a room that was so freshly painted and modernly decorated in every room. Service: front desk employees were excellent,; patient, cheerful, and helpful.Helped us with directions, etc. We saw a sign at desk mentioning a free shuttle to the MGM Grand regularly and back to Staybridge. Pool area: Never crowded. Nice pool and two jacuzzi's surrounded by some palm trees. Many chaise lounges, some with thick cushions, and 2 or 3 cabana types with the mattress and roof. BBQ grills, and outdoor tables for drinks and breakfast. FREE BREAKFAST!! This had bacon, sausage, scrambled eggs, omelets(egg type changed on the two days we were there)yogurt, breads, several types of fruit, juice, coffee, milk. Anything we couldn't eat(ate in our room) we just put in fridge for a snack later. There was a convenience type store right in the hotel. We bought a couple of micromeals. Not cheap as a regular grocery, but convenient. This was easy to find, a mapquest brought us right to it. Close to the strip, very close to airport. We are SO glad we did not spend more than twice as much to stay on the Strip! Since it is close to the airport there were planes taking off quite often, but from what we heard from others attending the wedding, it was much quieter than their hotels with music playing loudly all the time. Everyone who came to our room was jealous, and could not believe the price of less than $130.00 per night. They all said they would stay at the Staybridge if they ever came back to Las Vegas. I believe there was an exercise room, but did not check into all amenities. Awesome hotel, and terrific value!!!

Reviews.Title: “Top Quality - Incredible Value - Oasis of Tranquility”
Reviews.Author: ConanTheCorkonian
Reviews.Content: This place is excellent - the suites are huge, very modern, well designed and spotlessly clean. I have stayed in a lot of 4 and 5 star hotels around the world, and this is up there with any of them. Service is excellent and the staff were very friendly and helpful. Our room faced towards the highway and the strip, but we were not bothered by noise at all. The only slight downside is that it is not on the strip. Getting the shuttle to the strip takes about 20-25 minutes, including waiting for it. I don't know if you can get this level of quality on the strip though (maybe in the Bellagio), and you certainly won't get a quiet lobby and staff who remember you. Also the prices are excellent - I think I payed about 100 dollars per night.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely brilliant staff & facilities!”
Reviews.Author: sydney59
Reviews.Content: From Sydney Australia. Stayed here for 3 nights in October. I initially was going to book a hotel on the strip but after researching trip advisor I found this one. The hotel is about a 5min drive from the strip & there is a free shuttle every hour. It was great to leave all the noise & crowds behind each night as we went back to the hotel for a relaxing quiet night's sleep. The strip is more suited to singles or couples who want to party all night. The hotel staff were brilliant and allowed me an early check into a great suite with views directly overlooking the strip. The king bed was huge as was the queen sofa for 2 teenage boys. The room featured a kitchen & washer/dryer which was great for catching up on our laundry load for 4 people. Breakfast was complimentary & the selection was good. There is a pool, business centre & gym to use. Parking is free. Shopping was best at Las Vegas Premium Outlet (north end of strip). Don't forget to register on Chelsea Premium outlet website for discount coupons. We had a late flight on our last day & the staff locked our lugggage into a secure room for the day which allowed us a lot of freedom with sightseeing (drove to Hoover Dam approx 60mins). This hotel is more like a business/corporate/resort facility yet makes every family member feel at home. Absolutely brilliant staff & facilities. I will stay here in the future.

Reviews.Title: “This place is GORGEOUS”
Reviews.Author: tom2119
Reviews.Content: The best trip to Las Vegas I have ever had. One bedroom suite is huge ...staff is awesome!

Reviews.Title: “Glad we've choosen this one!”
Reviews.Author: Icegrapetea
Reviews.Content: Were there from 7Oct to 10Oct with my 16 months toddler. The place is just across Mandalay Bay. Taxi to hotel from airport about USD20. Free shuttle to MGM Grand once every hr! Fridge, washing machine, dryer, cooker, microwave, dish washer in suites very useful for me. 42" flat screen TV and comfortable bed. Mini mart in the hotel premise convenient for me. Pump station mins of walk away. Place is very clean and well maintained. Free daily breakfast and light dinner from tue to thurs save us a lot of money for shopping. Taxi to premium outlet about USD30.

Reviews.Title: “Not quiet at all!”
Reviews.Author: Cal48
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on recommendations of TripAdvisor. The noisiest place we have stayed in quite some time!! Our room looked out over toward the strip, freeway, and two busy roads that intersected right by the hotel. Awful - could not sleep at all! Room was nice and staff were very friendly. Would NOT recommend this place!

Reviews.Title: “As good as we expected”
Reviews.Author: madgio
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as the reviews were so good, we were not disappointed, clean, comfortable, friendly, good food, what more could we ask for!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT!”
Reviews.Author: lf-Norway
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one week and had a wonderful stay! I have absolutely nothing to complain about. We had a one bedroom apartment. We had a couple of days with temp. in the 100' s so we tried the pool! Loved that as well. The breakfast was nice - the staff just wonderful from the moment we checked in (after midnight by the way...) until or departure. We did not want to live on the strip and we don't gamble so, easy to choose. We chose this hotel based on the reviews here on Tripadvisor! LOVED IT! We will stay here again on our next vacation in Vegas! Thank you for making this place such a great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “$75 non-refundable pet fee and higher prices than online.”
Reviews.Author: strattc
Reviews.Content: We did not make reservations as we were on a road trip. When we arrived at the hotel we inquired as to the best available rate and the front desk clerk quoted us $25 more than the online price for the hotel. Also, they charge a $75 non-refundable pet fee. I can see charging a deposit, but traveler's like ourselves leave the room as we found it or better - you would never know a pet had been there so $75 seems high to us. Close to the strip (4 minutes drive) but nothing else around the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Statbridge Suites - stay there !”
Reviews.Author: wbph
Reviews.Content: Almost too good to be true. Polite and friendly staff and never heard the word 'no'. Excellent suite giving that ability to have a home away from home. Lovely pool and hot tub. Use the barbeque ? - no problem. We had a view across the bay - the Mandalay Bay, which is across the I15 and two other roads. No noise problems, even from the planes. Right away from all the noise and trilling machines it was an excellent location for us who wanted to visit LV other than to gamble. Highly recommended and will certainly be our number one place to stay when we go again.

Reviews.Title: “Other Reviews are right - Staybridge is Terrific!!!”
Reviews.Author: whitfang
Reviews.Content: Only 2 'problems': (1) Not right on The Strip! In our case, we enjoyed the relative quiet, but if you come to gamble/drink/party at night, you'd probably like being at the Bellagio, Ceasar's, etc. (2) Jets taking off are noisy! Close to the south end of the airport runways, so jets are at full power. They start at 6am and stop at 11pm, so it's not real bad, but you do notice them. And you ARE close to the airport if you are flying out. The rooms are super clean and roomy, nice bedding, nice TVs, nice pool and hot tubs, free exercise room, free business center with computers, free in-room Wi-Fi, good (hot) breakfast. The bacon was even crisp. No complaints at all staying here.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC”
Reviews.Author: mackleeds49
Reviews.Content: Fantastic friendly hotel.rooms are deluxe, pool area amazing.breakfast very nice.very quite away from the hustle and bustle of the strip.going back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and new hotel”
Reviews.Author: LighterWay
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great. Definitely newer and very clean. No smokiness that you get from the older hotels. Only downdise was that it was away from the strip. However since we had a car, this wasn't a problem at all. Loved it here and would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Most beautiful room I've ever stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: PicassosModel
Reviews.Content: If you want to stay on the strip, this is not the place. It is located just off the south end of the strip and has a shuttle that runs every hour to the MGM. It is beautifully decorated and has high end touches in the rooms like art niches, top of the line linens, custom furniture, two bathrooms, full kitchens and some have washers/dryers. It also has a very nice pool area with nice chaise lounges and plenty of extra towels. The breakfast is free and is very tasty and has a nice variety. We had no complaints at all. They even let us park our car there free for 8 days while we flew to Jamaica. There is a free shuttle to the airport, but you have to take a cab from the airport to the hotel which cost us $20 w/ tip. We will definitely stay here again when in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “They treated us like they appreciated our business.”
Reviews.Author: sunworshiperAlaska
Reviews.Content: This is the first time I have written a review. I felt compelled to do so because of the great service that experienced during my stay. Everyone had a smile and was very kind and helpful and seemed to really enjoy there job. The room was clean and well furnished. Bed was comfortable and bedding was plush. The breakfast was fresh and tasty with a wide assortment and everything was very clean. I really can't say enough good things about the hotel but it was the staff that really made the stay enjoyable to me. There is no shortage of nice places in Las Vegas to stay but I will return to the Staybridge Suites for all of my future travel plans.

Reviews.Title: “Marvelous Hotel. Highly recommended.”
Reviews.Author: martygSeattle_WA
Reviews.Content: This place is AMAZING VALUE.. PROS: It's not a casino hotel. Staff are friendly and helpful. Free food in the evenings and breakfast are great. Rooms are spacious, modern, quiet, and comfortable. Free shuttle to the strip. We also got a free ride to the airport. Free wireless internet. Great fitness center. CONS: These are small. The "music" around the pool is loud and annoying. We had to wait for ages for our crib, and sofabed, despite booking these and reminding the staff at check-in. It's a good 20-25 minute walk to the strip (but you can take the hourly shuttle), and it's a $20 taxi fare from the Wynn end of the strip.

Reviews.Title: “excellant hotel”
Reviews.Author: McDonaldsWales
Reviews.Content: booked due to recommendation from trip advisor, was not disappointed. The rooms are excellent, the staff have been extremely helpful, the breakfast was great and they have a shuttle bus that drops you off right in the middle of the strip. Value for money, cannot recommend this highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Alternative to The Strip”
Reviews.Author: CGDWaterloo_Ontario
Reviews.Content: This is a quiet, smoke-free oasis removed from The Strip, but a short, free transfer away. We were greeted by friendly staff and found a clean, well-appointed and maintained suite awaiting us. It had everything needed for a longer stay, including dishes, stove, micro, washer and dryer. And - the A/C was a quiet, temperature controlled unit. We enjoyed the large-size, cool pool and the excellent breakfast. This is great value for the little money we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rosalita22
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night at this hotel. We were given an upgrade to a one bedroom suite overlooking the pool (we'd booked a studio suite). The lady on reception was very helpful and friendly. The suite was exceptional - very clean and modern. We used the fitness centre, which had a great view overlooking the strip. Complimentary breakfast was nice too. Definitely stay here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Can't Fault This Place”
Reviews.Author: Ross_Eld
Reviews.Content: Its very seldom I give a place 5 stars, but this place was excellent in every way, plus Scott gave us a free upgrade - top notch place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: paulie47
Reviews.Content: This hotel is simply great, especially for the price. You should understand it is not the strip experience. It is a few blocks south and west of the strip. It is a non-gaming hotel. It has no room service (but an outside vendor can bring meals.) That said it was a tremendous place to stay. We got a full suite for $108 per night. Full kitchen with a stove as well as a microwave, dishes, etc. Full size refrigerator without the extortionist prices if you use it or move anything in it. Large living room. Two flat screen tvs, Large comfortable bed. Huge bathroom. Shower high enough that I didn't have to duck my 6'3" frame under it. Clean and modern. Breakfast is included, with eggs, fruit, cereal, etc. Nice pool, with salt and not chlorinated. Free wi-fi. It's near the take-off pattern of the airport, but is quiet inside. The people are all very friendly, and we asked for and got a late check-out with no hassle or extra price. Large and well equipped exercise room, with no extra charge to use it. There is a shuttle to the strip that runs about every hour to the MGM Grand. You can walk to Mandalay Bay for their buffet. Absolutely a great weekend in Vegas, thanks to Staybridge. I definitely would stay there again. The only criticism my wife had -- no full length mirror. Now that's pretty minor, not worth a half a star.

Reviews.Title: “This IS the #1 Hotel in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: LittleLucy30
Reviews.Content: After planning a trip to Vegas, my husband and I decided on Staybridge due to the ranking and reviews on this site. We were not disapponted. We were able to check in earlier than the 3PM check in and the room was everything we had expected. We stayed in the King Suite with a full kitchen and washer/dryer. We actually didn't use the kitchen as often as we thought we would, but used the washer and dryer every single day. The room itself was spotless and modern, with comfy couch and bed. The breakfast was great (since it was free!) but we didn't try the light dinner they served during the week. There was a little bit of street noise (room faced the strip) and we could hear airplanes occasionally, but overall the place was very quiet. The pool is oustanding, it's a large saltwater pool with a kiddie pool, and hot and cold jacuzzis. The location just off the strip and the fact that the entire hotel is non-smoking were high pluses. Staff was extremely helpful and very nice. I had to call one day because my room wasn't cleaned but they took care of it right away. If we ever decide to return to Vegas, we will return to Staybridge.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: BogeyPar
Reviews.Content: My brother and I flew out to Vegas to see a concert and do a little bit of gaming. As soon as I walked in the suite I was blown away by the size and "newness" of the suite. Stainless steel appliances separate sleep area with a King Bed, huge bath tub and a stand up shower. The couch was also a queen size bed and from what my brother said it was very comfortable. Two large flat screen TV's and stainless steel appliances. All I can say is that I would stay here again the next time I come out to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel off the Strip.”
Reviews.Author: Kevin_WalnutCreek
Reviews.Content: You can drive to the Strip and enjoy the free parking. The staff was very nice, and very interested in helping. I was in Las Vegas for business for 3 days and wanted a larger room with a kitchen. The room was a good size with a couch area. The kitchen was well stocked with utensils, along with a working freezer compartment. The bed was very comfortable. The AC was very forceful… either on and blowing hard of off and quite. The only downside was that the walls were a bit thin and the TV next door kept me up one night. The free breakfast was good each morning. The big HD flat screen (42”?) was nice.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful stay and great value for the money”
Reviews.Author: dreaminofcabo
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed at the Staybridge Suites this past Labor Day weekend. We usually stay on the strip on our Vegas trips but after realizing how expensive that would be on a holiday weekend, I looked into alternatives and noticed all the great reviews of this place here on Tripadvisor. I was a little apprehensive on how a hotel like this could be ranked #1 of ALL the hotels in Vegas, but after staying there I can definitely understand the rave reviews it gets. The hotel is located right on the other side of the I-15 highway from Mandalay Bay and THEhotel, and I would highly recommend it to anyone traveling to Vegas and has a car. It is not walking distance to the strip at all and while there is a shuttle that runs to the MGM, it only runs every hour and stops at 11pm, so we just drove to each place we wanted to go and took advantage of the free valet parking everywhere. When we checked in on Saturday, the front desk were telling a number of people ahead of us that they had overbooked rooms and would have to move them across the parking lot to the Fairfield Inn and Suites, but that they would get a refund back for their night stay. While it would've been nice to not pay for a night's stay, I didn't want to stay somewhere else, and luckily since I was a Priority Club member, a room was still available to us. We were assigned room 514 with a view of the pool. The room looked completely new, with a full kitchen, living room, large bathroom, separate bedroom with king bed, and even a washer/dryer in one machine. As others have mentioned, free breakfast is included in your stay and is served 7:30-10:30am on weekends, and 6:30-9:30am on weekdays. They had plenty of food, cereals, oatmeal, bagels/breads, yogurts, fruit, premade cheese omelets, sausage patties, biscuits, gravy, and a waffle maker that was quite popular. I also hung out at the pool one morning and there were only a handful of people around. They had comfy lounge chairs, as well as 3 cabanas for anyone to use. If you are looking for somewhere to stay with poolside service and $20 slushies, then this isn't the place for you, but if you want peace and quiet in the sun or shade, whatever your preference, this is the perfect spot. All in all, if I could get a good deal on the strip, I would probably prefer to stay there for the convenience. However, if the Staybridge is cheaper than what the strip has to offer, then I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again. You will not be able to find the conveniences of having your own kitchen, laundry facilities, free internet, and free breakfast anywhere else for this price.

Reviews.Title: “Great overall experience”
Reviews.Author: bjustice
Reviews.Content: The hotel is only about a mile from the Las Vegas strip. I was very pleased with the experience. We had a King Suite with a sleeper sofa - perfect for a couple with a teenager. The Kitchenette made it very convenient to have snacks and drinks on hand. The room was a good size. I would recommend for a family hotel near the strip. It is convenient to most things but not on the main drag of the strip. The room was clean,. the staff was courteous. Overall very positive - particularly for the price. I would definitely recommend to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “A must for families with little kids”
Reviews.Author: BeckyStepana
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 6-night stay at Staybridge, and can't say enough about our visit. The hotel is located just past "The Strip", which makes it far enough from the congestion, noise, smoke, poker machines and posters/videos of scantily-clad women to please any parent, but convenient enough to get there to see some of the sites (like the pirate show and volcano, big hits with the preschool set). The hotel offers a shuttle to the middle of the Strip, although we rented a car and parked at the casinos, which was free. The hotel is brand-spanking new, and the rooms are gigantic. We booked a king-suite, which included a separate bedroom for us with a door, pull-out sofa for our 5-year-old in the living room, small dining room & full kitchen complete with oven, dishwasher, and full washer/dryer. Big, new bathroom with double sinks. Balcony overlooking the pool (definitely request pool view, as the other side of the hotel looks at a highway). Maid service was spotless. Bed was super comfy, and the sofa-bed not bad either. Two flat-screen TVs, one in each room. The pool is large, with a great shallow end for little kids (about 1 ½ feet deep) with fountains cascading from a wall. They have two hot tubs, cabanas (free!) and nice squishy loungers. Couldn't get my daughter out of the pool, and there were few people in it the entire week, either because it's a little off-season or because most of the adults were off at the casinos. We felt like we owned the place. There's an outdoor gas grill for guests to use – go buy a steak and grill it up (cheaper and tastier than at the casinos). Breakfast includes hot dishes – rotation of omelets or scrambled eggs, sausage, bacon, and all of the usual continental fare like bagels, danish, oatmeal. Oh, and make-your-own waffles. On Tues-Thurs they also serve a 530 PM appetizer buffet, with hotdogs/burgers fresh from the grill, tacos, salad bar, etc. But what made breakfast/appetizer service really special was Sandra, the woman who runs the dining room. She was so welcoming and hospitable – she went in the back to get my daughter fruit during one of the evening meals, and if we showed up a little early or late for breakfast, she made sure we had something to eat. (A lot of hungover patrons made similar comments after dragging downstairs too late for breakfast...) It's rare to find such attentive and warm service these days, and she set a great standard. Oh, they had free internet in the business center, and a really nice fitness center overlooking the mountains. Vegas is exciting and there's a lot to do at the Strip (don't miss Zion and Bryce!), but if you're with kids, it's REALLY nice to have a haven from all the glitter and just relax at a place that's really welcoming to families. We'd definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful place! Highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: aprata
Reviews.Content: I am a tripadvisor fanatic - I read and take reviews very seriously. We booked a one bedroom king size suite for one night (August 28-29 2009), since we needed to stay in Vegas for one night for a family trip, and we wanted a clean place that did not take forever to get around like the huge strip hotels yet was close to everything and had all the amenities. I am so glad we chose Staybridge Suites! We usually travel to 4-5 star resorts so I was skeptical whether I would indeed find similar quality, yet we did! We arrived 11:30 am, way too early, yet staff was wonderful and checked us in immediately - we had suite 500, very private, last suite at the end of the hallway, with a pool view. The whole hotel is very clean, new and modern, and there is no trace of that musty smell that comes with most old(er) mega hotels on the strip. It is a non-smoking property as well, and everything was fresh and clean. The one bedroom was just like a timeshare apartment - full kitchen with Whirlpool stainless steel appliances, two flat screen large TVs (one in bedroom and one in living room), AC, two (smaller) closets with hangers, dining table with chairs, small balcony with two chairs and one table, alarm clock, washer and drier in unit, bathroom with double sinks. Free breakfast is nice, yet for a healthy eater I could not find many healthy choices - they had pastries, eggs with cheese inside (that was the part that I did not like, the cheese made the meal heavy), the fresh fruit was sunk in sweet syrup, bagels, waffles. Very good meal if you are not terribly health conscious. The business center has free internet and printing, so you can print boarding passes, which we did since we did not carry our laptop with us, but wireless is also free if you need it. Parking is free, there are no resort fees, no additional charges other than the nightly room rate plus tax. The pool was lovely, there were towels available on the back of the chairs, there is shade and actual cabanas with mattresses to lay on, which usually you only find at 4-5 star resorts only. We did not use the free shuttle but I understand there is a free shuttle to the strip every hour until 11 pm. Overall, we loved this place - if you want to be close to the strip yet away from its craziness, if you want a clean, new, modern place with no musty smell, if you want no resort fees and wireless fees and all sorts of extra charges, and free breakfast, this is the place for you. I would stay here again with no hesitation when we go back to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem, visit ASAP before the secret of this place is out”
Reviews.Author: Hooleybooley
Reviews.Content: This hotel is such a hidden gem. We stayed here for two nights in the second week of August but it appeared we were two of only a few people staying here (mostly families). We had the Pool and two Jacuzzi's to ourselves during the day - although temperatures were hitting an all time high at 107degrees & we spent most of it under the umbrellas and cushioned loungers. There were 4 poster bed style loungers too if you wanted them. We had a nosey in the pool area of the Luxor and this was heaving with people all crammed into the pool area - the Staybridge was a breath of fresh air. The rooms were fab and brand new, the beds were huge and were very high. I'm only 5ft 2 and I needed to jump a bit to get on them!! The kitchen was fully equiped with everything you needed with free coffee and popcorn and also had a washer and a dryer. Location wise, the hotel is not on the strip. In fact it is on the other side of the I15, this meant we had to drive 5 mins to the strip but we parked for free at the Luxor. So it wasn't that much of a problem. We did have an issue with a trip we had organised and the organisers would not pick us up from our location, we had to drive to them - I think this is more an issue with the organisers of the trip - Pallion Helicopters. Breakfast was good with fresh fruit and hot options but dinner was poor (soup & a poor limp salad(limp due to the weather I think)) - both were free which was a added bonus for a self catering facility. Finally, this hotel is close to the airport and I15 but no noise is heard in the hotel at all.

Reviews.Title: “The StayBridge Suites is the answer...!!”
Reviews.Author: tcranla
Reviews.Content: StayBridge Suites is the answer, whether you are traveling alone, on business, or with your family. StayBridge Suites is the "bridge" between the comforts of home and luxury hotel living. The hotel staff and management team are proud of what has been accomplished here. Their pride shows on their smiling faces and an eager to please attitude that begins with a delicious full course breakfast, a late afternoon snack, or a late night swim.Staybridge Suites is exactly what I've been looking for in travel to Las Vegas, or anywhere else. Sincerely, Tracie Craig-Porter

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: Juliathesecond
Reviews.Content: An absolutely fantastic hotel, the staff especially were perfect; friendly, approachable, full of personality without being over the top. The rooms were all spacious, comfortable, clean and well furnished. The shuttle service to the strip was excellent. The atmosphere at breakfast and in the afternoons in the lounge area, and by the pool was very friendly without being intrusive. We were so glad that we stayed off the strip, it was the best hotel we stayed in of our whole holiday in America. I would absolutely recommend it to anyone, and we would definately stay there again. I can't praise the whole experience of the hotel enough.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely top notch!!”
Reviews.Author: Backtrack7
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic hotel, we have just returned from a two week stay and I cannot fault any aspect. The staff, without exception, are friendly and courteous and do their utmost to ensure you enjoy your stay. We had a one bed suite and it was incredible, very roomy and very well equipped - the hotel opened fairly recently so everything is brand new. The complimentary breakfast is fine, fresh fruit, cereal, scrambled eggs, bacon, bagels, toast, waffles etc etc and they also provide three decent evening meals for all guests (Tue-Thu). The hotel runs a shuttle bus service to the strip every hour and they will also come and pick you up - saves a fortune on taxi fares. They will also run you to the airport! The pool is really nice, very quiet during the week and although the hotel is a little busier at the weekend the pool is still under used. Location wise you are 10 minutes from the strip (shuttle) but there is no entertainment in the immediate vicinity of the hotel - if you are absolutely stuck there is a petrol station about five minutes away that sells the sort of food that petrol stations sell and there are other like hotels/motels in the area such as the Marriot Inn and Holiday Inn express. After a wander around each they cannot compare with the opulence of the Staybridge. We had a meal in the Marriot and it wasn't particularly good. There is also free Internet access and the use of a safety deposit box (also free). Maid service is provided every day, they make the bed, and sort the bathroom and the kitchen(replenishing the basics - coffee, popcorn etc) but do not tidy up the general living area. If you have a hire car there is Walmart Supercentre just over 15 mins away if you need to stock up on goodies.

Reviews.Title: “Oustanding value and service levels”
Reviews.Author: Dave F
Reviews.Content: Simply the best value hotel we have ever stayed in anywhere in world!! . So many great comments have been made on TA and don't need to repeat however we agree with them. A few practical comments I have not seen but may help. 1. Shuttle bus is excellent ( leaves 'top of hour' to strip and 'bottom of hour' to airport but only on request, so if you are on strip and want bus home you need to ring reception, as if no-one is going to strip you won't get picked up. Shuttle bus drivers are so helpful, indeed called at Petrol sation/Food store opposite for us to pick up beer/water and used his ID for us as we didn't have ours ( in Vegas need ID all the time irrespective of age! We didn't need a car. 2. Pool is large, clean and have a good suppy of clean towels, and enough sun beds for all. 3. We found location superb. Whilst strip is great fun we didn't want to be on it 24/7. For a quiet night there is free Pizza delivery to hotel, and of course you can stock Your own fridge/freezer up with drinks! 4. Our daughter particularly enjoyed the free Wi Fi throughout hotel. 5. Fitness Suite was superb. Its large, several machines and well air conditioned. 6. Didn't try the evening meal Mon-Thurs but is there if you would like it. Breakfast is excellent, and the girl who served us every morning really friendly. 7 . Nothing was too much trouble for front desk staff. Scott in particular was great. also may help... 1. We did the Sundance Grand Canyon 4 in 1 trip which was superb. Recommend pre -booking as there was limited availability. 2. We went to watch Jersey Boys at Venetian Hotel.. again would recommend.
