After 3 weeks on holiday starting in Vegas, then touring West Coast we are still talking about this hotel and the excellent levels of service and value for money If you are adamant you want to stay on strip then clearly Staybridge isn't and it is too far to walk, but apart from that I would say it was for us as close to faultless as you can get and I consider myself balanced and fair and don't normally give anything top marks!

Reviews.Title: “A peaceful calm place to stay in Las Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: foggy_hall_travellor
Reviews.Content: Stayed here to catch our breath en route from San Francisco to the Grand Canyon and Bryce. Everything the rave reviews say is true wonderful spacious accomodation and a lovely pool. Great variety of items on the breakfast buffet. Decided to return for two more nights on our return from the Canyons before flying home. The second time we were upgraded to a huge suite with picture windows looking down the towards the strip. If you want to be in the middle of the hustlers on the strip this isn't the place for you. For me I had a lovely time relaxing time by the pool and taking advantage of the free laundry facilities - the first time I've arrived home with suit cases full of clean clothes. Thanks to all the helpful staff on reception and the Shuttle bus driver who rescued us from the strip when we'd had enough.

Reviews.Title: “Great value off the strip”
Reviews.Author: mikekSingapore
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Staybridge because of the excellent TripAdvisor.com reviews. We were not disappointed. This is an excellent choice for families going to Las Vegas. The highlights are the following: * Full suites with kitchen * Free, Excellent breakfast every morning (eggs, waffles, sausage, cereal) * Free dinner served on Tue, Wed, Thu (soup, hambugers, hot dogs) * No extra charges for exercise room, Wi-Fi We had many family over to our suite. They were staying at hotels on The Strip. Everyone was jealous of our room and accommodations at the Staybridge. I would strongly recommend getting a rental car if staying at the Staybridge. It is a short 5 minute drive from the Airport and only 5 minutes to The Strip. A key benefit is to relax in your room or by the pool. It is helpful to have a car so you can visit a grocery store or go to different Strip Casinos. The hotel does have shuttle going to the MGM Grand every 30 minutes. We thoroughly enjoyed our visit and would suggest staying at the StayBridge for any visitors to Vegas, but especially families. If you're just going to Vegas to gamble and party, then this isn't the place for you. There's no casino, no restaurants, no bar.

Reviews.Title: “Totally Amazing - The Best!”
Reviews.Author: Garya2404
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Staybridge Suits on the 6th and 7th August 2009. This hotel is the best I have ever stayed in. We had a one bedroomed apartment that came with a full kitchen, oven, microwave, hob, dishwasher, washing machine, tumble dryer. A huge living area with a dining table, L shaped settee and a 50" TV. The the bedroom had a massive bed with TV, wardrobes bath area two sinks and a door leading into the shower / toilet room! The staff at this hotel were like your own family and could not do enough to make everything just right. They have a swimming pool that is good for adults and children along with two seperate hot tubs. Whn you are by the pool they come around and offer you clean towels about every hour or so! The hotel also run a shuttle bus into the airport and strip at Vegas which is only about 5 minutes away, this departs on the hour upto 10pm and then coming back it picks you up outside the side entrance to the MGM at half past the hour with the last one being at 10:30pm. This hotel was built for timeshare options and the company offering the timeshares could not get them sold so Staybridge purchased the whole building and made a few changes and now its the best hotel in the area.........Stay here and just enjoy the luxry and quality of this hotel 10 out of 10 in all areas! Well done Staybridge staff you are all amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: kisssmeimirish
Reviews.Content: this hotel was great, my friend and I stayed in circus circus last time we were here which was a dump so this time we booked somewhere that wasn't your typical tacky vegas hotel. when we got there the cute guy and reception upgraded us to a bigger suite for free. the staff were always really friendly and the room was amazing-2 plasma TV screens, huge bedroom,sitting room,kitchen and bathrooms. breakfast was great, it was only supposed to be served til 10.30 but when we struggled down stairs at 12 after a night out they made us some anyway. this hotel is great and there is a shuttle bus to the strip every 30 min-however its not within walking distance. overall it was great to be able to access the strip so easily and still be able to come back to a really nice quite hotel. 10/10

Reviews.Title: “Off the Strip oasis”
Reviews.Author: Scooter14
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 4 day visit to Staybridge Suites Las Vegas. Based upon Trip Advisor reviews decided to try. Met and exceeded every expectation. Have previously stayed everywhere on Strip from Bellagio to Venetian etc in 25 years of trips. This was the best. Room was first class in every way - marble entry, 2 flat screens, full kitchen, great A/C. Lovely, quiet pool. Parking right by front door. Excellent daily breakfast with smiling, helpful faces-Jason and Sandra. For a great local casino drive 5 miles south to South Point.. $ 88 a night prepay and they upgraded us at check-in. So much better than walking through casino to get to room, dealing with casino parking and crowded pool. Highly recommend!!!

Reviews.Title: “What a Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: VegasnMead
Reviews.Content: Unbelievably close to the strip without all the hassles of the strip. What a great place to stay. The rooms were extremely clean and every piece of furniture was comfortable. The kids enjoyed sleeping on the pull out sofa, while the parents had a great room to themselves. The kitchen was fully stocked with all materials needed to prepare meals. However there is a complimentary breakfast included with the stay that should not be passed up. From fruits, to cereals, to make your own waffle to sausage or bacon or even cheese omelettes. This place had it all. I know the next time i plan to visit Las Vegas, I am making my reservations at Staybridge. On top of all this, the staff at Staybridge was extremely nice, helpful, and knowledgable. Even the complimentary shuttle driver that would take you and pick you up from the MGM... We are definitely going back to STAYBRIDGE.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel. We will definately return again.”
Reviews.Author: lrfisher73
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel, and we will stay here again. I highly reccomend this hotel. The hotel was very clean. The staff was friendly and helpful. It was a great hotel to stay with children. I loved the fact that it had a kitchen, and the breakfast in the morning was good and fun for the kids too. There is a shuttle that took us over to the strip and it runs all day; very convenient. The pool is nice and clean, not as crowded as other hotel pools we have visited; a big plus!! The view from our room was awesome! The vegas strip at night is amazing!!

Reviews.Title: “Spacious suite with everything.”
Reviews.Author: cartist
Reviews.Content: Our suite had everything including washer-dryer, flat screen TVs in the living room and the bedroom, full stove and microwave, and a great view of the skyline. Helpful staff and a good business center topped off a great stay. Not on the strip nor near the casinos, this was not a bad thing as it meant the hotel was quiet. It took 15 minutes to get onto the strip when we wanted night-life.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay at the Staybridge Suites Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: MannyH
Reviews.Content: We aren't gamblers but love to go to Vegas for the Entertainment Shows and Food. So naturally this was an excellent hotel away from the strip. It's close to the airport, freeways and around the corner from the strip if you need to access it. In fact, it's close enough where on my stays I did some runs (exercise) to the strip and back. The hotel itself was very nice. Full kitchen, washer and dryer a very comfortable king bed and a comfortable sofa bed. We had the pool view which I thought is much better than the freeway view but you can't go wrong with any room in this hotel. You get free wifi internet in your room, lobby and pool areas with complimentary breakfast. The lady that prepares the food there is just the greatest! Highly recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Best value for your money”
Reviews.Author: HugoC
Reviews.Content: Price quality wise this hotel is difficult to beat. Big 2 room suite, very comfortable king size bed and comfortable queen sofa bed (no complaints from my daughters, on the contrary they also enjoyed their big flat screen TV). Well equipped kitchen, nice balcony, big pool, shuttle to the strip (until 10pm), copious breakfast and (from Monday till Thursday) a complementary light evening meal. What do you need more? I forgot: very friendly and efficient personnel, easy to reach and ample parking space.

Reviews.Title: “Good alternative to the Strip”
Reviews.Author: RoscoToronto
Reviews.Content: Main advantage is the room size and location to the strip and highways. We had car rental and the location was the best for getting all around the Vegas area. Room almost as big as a condo. We have 2 teenagers and they enjoyed having the living room queen sofabed and flat screen TV all to themselves. Wireless internet was great as was the buffet breakfast which was a step above the usual continental breakfast you usually see. Downsides, not many, just had to ask for linens to make up the sofabed after arriving (at midnight) and having to constantly ask for more towels and washclothes from housekeeping everyday (rooms are for 4 people but they leave only enough for 2?) Overall though, very good.

Reviews.Title: “A luxurious gem at a bargain price.”
Reviews.Author: BMRC
Reviews.Content: What a gem in the middle of the desert! and all for €63 per night (midweek). We stayed two nights and it was easily the best value hotel I've ever stayed in. The hotel is only opened since Sept '08 so everything is sparklig new. The suites are like a self contained apartment with a fully equipped kitchen stocking the best quality delph and cutlery. There is even a dishwasher and free laundry facilities downstairs. The bed and bed lien were superb (way too much bed clothes for the 110 degrees of heat). We had our own balcony too. Midweek the hotel provides an evening reception with salads, tacos, sausages etc available.. Breakfast had omelettes, sausage, eggs bacon etc as well as fruit and yogurts. Incredible service. Perhaps the rates are not so good at weekends but they can't be that much dearer. The hotel did provide a free shuttle service to and from the strip as well. It is about a two mile trip and the shuttle runs until 10.30pm. A taxi for coming home later will cost about €10. We missed the shuttle one morning (runs every hour) and decided to walk as it didn't look to be too long of a walk. MISTAKE!........ We meandered around the Manderlay hotel to get to the strip in incredible "hot hairdryer" type heat at 10.00am............it took ages and not to be recommended. Vegas is not made to suit pedestrians, no footpaths etc. This hotel is just great and the fact that it's not on the strip I consider to be a bonus. We visited Caser's Palace and other similar hotels..... Who wants to stay in such places when you come down to the lobby to see endless rows of slot machines?? Not for me. Staybridge gave you a break from the strip and a lot of luxury thrown in!

Reviews.Title: “Best value in Las Vegas and close to strip”
Reviews.Author: busytraveler50
Reviews.Content: full size kitchens in room - best value in Las Vegas and amazing fitness room with views overlooking the strip

Reviews.Title: “Staybridge suite Las Vegas is value for your money!”
Reviews.Author: Bussybee09
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because of the great reviews I read online and I was not disappointed. Words cannot describe how clean and ultra-modern the hotel suites are- 2 flat screen tvs, dining area, beautiful kitchen with utensils and pots, large refrigerator/freezer and a balcony. I would definitely choose this place again if I plan to stay off strip. Great gym, free wi-fi, free breakfast and about 1-2 miles from the strip. Absolutely great value for my money.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: diddlina
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in this hotel on a two day trip to Las Vegas and if we ever go back, we will definitely stay in this hotel again. The hotel is 5 mins away from the Strip, which is not a bad thing. There is an excellent and reliable free shuttle service to the Strip. The staff are very friendly and helpful. The hotel is well furnished. It is probably the cleanest hotel we have ever stayed in. The complimentary breakfast is very good. Our room had a little kitchen with all that you may need, including mugs, cutlery and tea towels. There was even a small bottle of washing up liquid. There are no restaurants or shops nearby but the hotel's mini market is well stocked.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury at a great price!”
Reviews.Author: vickisue54
Reviews.Content: Although our stay began with a reservation glitch, I would totally recommend this beautiful hotel a bit off the strip but within a short shuttle ride. The sweet woman at the front desk told us to go upstairs to their business center where we fixed the problem. She even stored our luggage in their secured area and then upgraded us for our trouble. The room was really a condo, not even a hotel room, quite spacious and tastefully decorated. Two flat screen TVs, one in the living room and one in the bedroom. Lovely tiled bathroom with a soaking tub, double sinks, high end ammenities. The kitchen was fully equipped if we had wanted to cook, but the lovely front desk clerk had already told us about some nearby restaurants that were very good and reasonably priced. Then there was the terrific pool, spa and exercise area. Wow! We were amazed these weren't more heavily used, but glad we could feel like we were in a private club. Another above the norm perk was the full breakfast in a restaurant sized room attended by friendly staff which was probably the best we had on this and many other trips. We noted ofcourse that this property was rated #1 by TripAdvisor and I can completely agree!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: severnmd
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on the June 30th. The desk staff was very friendly and helpful. Even though we came about 40 minutes earlier than the usual check in time, she provided us a nice room, The room was very spacious, and had a separate sleeping are for the adults. The kitchen was beautiful and had brand new stainless steel appilances. Hotel provided the light dinner on the June 30th, and it was not bad. The breakfast was also good.

Reviews.Title: “New, clean, excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mr_Blue_111
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on last night in Las Vegas before flying out, based on Trip Advisor feedback-- was an excellent experience. Large, modern, comfortable suite with all amenities, including full kitchen and washer/dryer--for a great rate. Not a beautiful location (next to freeway), but the hotel itself is well designed, is not noisy and offers very convenient access to the airport. Staff were efficient and accommodating. If you are looking for a safe, clean, convenient place to rest, with free shuttle to MGM Grand, this is a great option.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: kimrj2
Reviews.Content: Overall I enjoyed by recent week long stay at the Staybridge Suites. Location is just off the strip...excellent if you want to avoid traffic and the noisy, smoke filled casions. Just walking through some of the casino hotels, the lines for check in/out were extremely long...didn't have to deal with that. Front desk/management staff was very friendly and professional. Check in time is at 3:00 p.m.; however we arrived around 12:00 and was able to check in. The 1 BR suite was really nice, flat screen tv, seperate tub and shower, double sink in tub area and another sink in the shower/lavatory area. Sectional sofa and flat screen tv in the sitting area along with a dinner table for 4. Bed was extremely comfortable with flat screen on the wall in the BR. We chose the "strip view " as oppose to the pool view. We had a rental so we did not encounter the shuttle bus problems mentioned in the other reviews. Problems -- Being that we stayed for a week, the first 3 days the maid service was wonderful. However, around mid-stay it was horrible. One day we did not receive services at all and had to wait an hour or so for towels. The next day, the bed was made, but the tub had not been cleaned, only a few towels were left (no hand or face towels). One day I thought I saw the maid take a hand towel from one rack, turn it inside out, and place it on the other rack (wasn't for sure so I didn't say anything). At the end of the stay, I was totally disgusted with the maid service. I had planned to leave a tip at the end of the stay; however, the only tip she received was to do a BETTER JOB! Also, our room was above the workout facilities and I had to call the front desk several times to complain about guests dropping weights...very annoying! Just don't stay on the 3rd floor above the workout facility (which is on the 2nd floor). By the way, they did offer to move us, but who wants to pack up all their stuff and move???? Other than that, the hotel is a good choice for the $$$ (around $100 a night) to be near the strip. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Came away impressed”
Reviews.Author: NeverUnpacked
Reviews.Content: We came to town the night before we had originally planned (we travel space available), so we chose a room here (at $90) for one night rather than an extra night (at $569) at Mandalay Bay, which is down the street and where we were spending the rest of our long weekend. Our experience here at Staybridge was very positive. Check in was quick, and the desk clerk and security guard were very friendly and helpful. We opened the door to the room and were impressed with the space and amenities. Everything was clean and new. We decided to take the night off, relax in the suite, have a cocktail on the small veranda and move on in the morning. The bed was very comfortable so we slept in on Saturday and nearly missed breakfast. The one problem was that there were no eggs by that time (9:20 am). Everything else was adequate, but not spectacular; we brought our meal back and ate in the room since the breakfast area was quite full and everything we needed was in our own kitchen. Before leaving, we decided to check out the pool. There were only a few people there, so rather than fight the crowd at MB, we checked out of the room but asked to stay and use the pool, which was fine with them. We spent the day relaxing in the sun (and shade) on the padded lounges and retiring to the (free) cabana for a quick nap. There were no added amenities with the cabana (TV, shower, personalized service) like other pools, but it was just right for our day. We stayed until mid-afternoon and proceeded to the rest of our weekend at Mandalay Bay. Our stay was only for the one night and since there were only two of us, our reservation was accurate and we had our own rental car for transportation, we didn't encounter any of the problems that a few other guests have experienced. We found it to be a very good value and would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not that great!?”
Reviews.Author: Senor6
Reviews.Content: Upon further review there seems to be some kinks in the Staybridge armor. Check-in was a breeze and very friendly front desk staff. We were given 3 keys and quickly headed up to our pool facing suite. All amenities appeared to be in working order and clean. As bedtime approached (we were there on a semi-business trip) we discovered that the pull out sofa had no linens. Why I ask were we not informed of this at check in? Service?? So a phone call was made to the front desk around 10ish and he said it would be up right away with the linens. 30 minutes pass and no linens, junior is getting tired and would like to rest on his sofa sleeper. Now I go down to the front desk and demand the linens and refuse to leave until they appear. He had forgotten to call housekeeping and they were on their way, yadayadayada. So I wait at the front desk another 10 minutes or so for them to finally arrive. We put junior down and all is good or so it seems. Now it is past 11 and granted it was a Friday night, but the rock music (great tunes) wa sblaring by the pool and numeorus guests were enjoying a late night dip. My experience with hotels in Vegas is around dusk they close, not here. So at 11:15 another call to the front desk asking them to turn off the LOUD music and ask the guests to leave the pool area. 30 minutes pass and still we hear Smoke on the Water at a party level. Finally the misses has had enough and she marches doewn to the front desk. They were engaged in conversation (front desk and security guard) and had forgotten about my earlier phone call. Said something like; "I didn't realize that the music was still on." So to make a long story short; rooms are nice (ask for linens at check in), exercise room well equipped, breakfast is fine (no bacon!), location is convenient to south strip,but service is lacking if non existent. So often in Las Vegas the hotel staff really go out of their way to ensure that the guest is satisfied and this was definetly not the case at the Staybridge Suites.

Reviews.Title: “As Great as We Had Hoped”
Reviews.Author: jbellour
Reviews.Content: This is a great find. We decided to go to Vegas on the spur of the moment and booked the Staybridge based on TripAdvisor #1 rating. Did I tell you I love TripAdvisor? The room was ready when we arrived at 3 pm, and it was a great little suite with a 4th floor view of the Las Vegas Strip. The room was spotless and well designed with nice high ceilings, unobstructed balcony views, an efficient kitchenette with all table settings, cookware, etc., and a spacious bathroom. The hotel is about a quarter mile from Las Vegas Blvd (the "Strip") just East of I-15 at the Russell Ave interchange. While the walk is feasible, it is a little long on a hot day. I'd recommend you take the hourly hotel shuttle that goes to a major hotel on the Strip. Or if you have a car, drive to one of the free parking garages of any mega-hotel/casino and make it your base for little walking jaunts on the strip, then drive back to the hotel. The Staybridge is very accessible, and is certainly much quieter than any of the Strip Hotels. The staff, from the front desk to housekeeping to the breakfast room, were all gracious, helpful and made us feel like special guests. Plus, it's a NO Smoking hotel. AND they have a great complimentary breakfast each morning in a well furnished lounge area, with real scrambled eggs, bacon/sausage and make-your-own waffles. This hotel is an excellent value. We were treated very well with service you'd be lucky to get at a hotel at 3 times the price. We'll definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “I really wanted to agree with the others!”
Reviews.Author: bushlamo
Reviews.Content: After reading all the reviews on TA, I changed a two-night Las Vegas stay from the No. 2 hotel to the No. 1 TA rated Staybridge Suites. Now, I'm a tad sorry I did that. All other reviews on TA are pretty accurate--the hotel itself is great, the staff is for the most part, friendly and professional. It SHOULD have been a great stay. So want went wrong? Here comes the list: 1. Upon entering the room, noticed a very nice dark brown sectional sofa with one cusion from another sofa (it was bright green and white). Could have been overlooked, but a bit tacky! 2. Three people in the room with a sleeper sofa and a separate bedroom. No linens for the sleeper sofa. Had to call the desk. My opinion only, but they should have known that with three people we needed the extra linen. 3. Only one roll of toilet paper in room--that three people thing again. 4. On the second day, the air conditioner was not cooling efficiently. Maintenance tried to fix it, but said the room would have to be shut down. We opted to say in the room rather than move, however, another item was added to this list. 5. Maid cleaned room, said she would bring fresh towels later. When she brought them back, they were damp. Used or poor drying? 6. First morning there were no eggs at the breakfast bar. Several people had to wait to get scrambled eggs. 7. They advertise "Sundowners" with beer and wine, and a "limited bar" on their website, however, they have no liquor license as yet and have neither. 8. There is apparently a governor on the shower handle. You couldn't take a HOT shower if you wanted to. It was, at best, a bit above lukewarm. 9. And now, the straw that broke the camel's back: We were told on check-in of the shuttle service to MGM Grand and told it ran on the hour, or if needed, call, and it would pick us up right away. The last night in Vegas, we hurried to catch the shuttle on the hour. We arrived 10 minutes early, no shuttle. Another couple was also waiting. Called the hotel and was told "He should be on his way, if not we'll send him." Thanked them and sat down to wait. It's about a 10 minute trip. Sat down to wait. No shuttle. Called the desk again. "He's on the way. Should be there soon." Half hour later, the shuttle showed up. Driver said he was sorry, but had to go to the airport. So, for an hour, because no one told us where the shuttle actually was, five of us stood around waiting. We could have had a drink, did a bit more touring, whatever. Instead, we waited by the pick-up point because he was supposedly going to be there "any minute." Not a good way to run a railroad (or a shuttle)! In closing, all I can say is that if these folks get it together there, they have a wonderful place to stay in Vegas, but I cannot say that I truly enjoyed my stay there this time!

Reviews.Title: “Very very pleased.”
Reviews.Author: trooper2009
Reviews.Content: For £60 you get a huge place with all nice and new finishes. Also the pool is ace and nice and quiet. Only thing i would highlight is the shuttle bus needed to take you to strip on the hour and takes 10 mins- this ends at 23:00 - taxi fare from strip only $13 roughly. This hotel is away from the stip with no games/casinoes nearby - great for quiet get away after the full rush of Vegas- I would go back there again as i liked the peace before the buzz! Oh this hotel is right next to the motorway- although you don't hear a thing with the new doors/windows- nice to be away from the strip and i at 29 love loud partying although loved the peace.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place.. Everything was just as all the reviews said!”
Reviews.Author: ritapopita
Reviews.Content: I chose this place based on all the great reviews.We were very happy. My husband was very pleased with big screen t.v. and the very comfortable bed. The breakfast was yummy and lot's of choices. If you don't want to walk through a huge smoke filled casino to get to your room a half an hour later this is the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: Czufam
Reviews.Content: The hotel is everything that has been described in the posted reviews. I would however change a couple of things about the shower. It has no place to set soap and shampoo, not even an upper ledge. While the shower itself is about 4' x 2' the shower head and handle to adjust it are facing the side that is 2'.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat this one if you want to stay off the strip.”
Reviews.Author: tannedboy
Reviews.Content: Hotel was brand new. Great pool, free breakfast, free shuttle to and from MGM Grand. The rooms were huge and gorgeous. Our room had a living room, kitchen, dining table, bedroom with king bed and large bathroom. Stayed at Caesar's Palace two nights before staying here. Staybridge rooms were a lot nicer (and were less than $100/night). If you are looking for a great place that is off the strip yet really close, you can't beat this place. The pool is large and has plenty of seating available. I still can't believe this place is around $100/night!

Reviews.Title: “Great value and service”
Reviews.Author: s_geo
Reviews.Content: I researched this hotel on tripadvisor before choosing this hotel due to its rave reviews. Good news is that we enjoyed the stay as well. We checked in earlier than 3 pm with no issue. All matters were handled quickly and with ease. Location is well suited to be away from casino busyness. Very close to the I15 freeway as well..

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Find!”
Reviews.Author: TencatNewMexico
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Staybridge Suites for four nights during a family vacation based on the reviews on this site, and we were not disappointed. From the time we checked in to the time we left, we were treated so well by all staff we encountered. They were friendly and helpful. When we checked in we needed a crib and roll away bed. Both were brought to us promptly, with a few extra pillows and blankets that we hadn't asked for, which was a nice touch. The room was probably the quietest room I've ever stayed in; no in-hotel noise could be heard even when the hotel was at full capacity. We had a nice view of the strip from our room. The room had a washer and dryer which came in handy with a 2 month old baby. The only thing that could be improved is the breakfast area which does not have enough indoor seating. All in all a wonderful stay at an affordable price. We'll stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Value and Quality”
Reviews.Author: Eb0y
Reviews.Content: Me, my wife and my 16 month old stayed for 4 nights while visiting Vegas. The place was near new and well appointed with full size kitchen, washer, dryer etc. The swimming pool and BBQ areas were excellent as was the gym.The hotel was spotlessly clean throughout. All the staff were very friendly and helpful. There is a regular shuttle bus going to and from the Strip dropping you at the MGM Grand (about a 2 mile drive). We found the hotel very child friendly and was a very relaxing place to stay so close to the hustle of the Strip. It was fantastic value for money as I think we payed only about $90 a night. I highly recommend the Staybridge Suites of Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Super nice staff and big rooms! A top value in Las Vegas.”
Reviews.Author: Westinhan
Reviews.Content: Staybridge Suites Las Vegas is less than 10 minutes away from the airport and is located next to the 15 Freeway. You can sometimes hear planes flying by, but it is not noisy enough to keep you from sleeping (and I am a sensitive sleeper). They cannot pick you up from the airport due to local laws, but they will drop you back off for free. Nearby are other similar-looking Suites and motels. The location is not convenient as it costs about $15 by taxi to get to the Las Vegas Strip. If you have a car though, I don't think it will be a big issue. There is a free shuttle provided every hour, at the hour to the MGM Grand Las Vegas Hotel & Casino. The front desk staff are super nice and they really go out of their way to be helpful! I would say they are one of the best hotel staff that I have ever experienced. I really want to commend them for their service. They are the highlight of this hotel. I would describe them as friendly, attentive to detail, kind, and busy! A single staff member will juggle multiple phone calls, someone trying to buy something at the store next door, and try to help you. I especially liked the black lady though I don't remember her name. I give them all a big thumbs up! The lobby is quite nice. This is a four-story building that I believe was intended to be an apartment or condo-type of thing. There is a pool (it is okay) and a couple of jacuzzis outside. And there is parking in the front which I believe is free. Because these were intended to be apartments, they are very big! We stayed in the King-size bed bedroom suite and there was a bedroom with King-size bed, a very large bathroom, a living room, a kitchen, and balcony. It was wonderful that a washer and dryer were included. You can buy detergent for $2 at Bridgemart which is basically a space next to the front desk where they have food, beverages, and other items and is run by the front desk. I would describe the furnishings as upscale middle-class. The room was very nice, but I would not call it luxury. I really liked the fact that it was a full apartment with kitchen and I think this would be a great place to stay for a week or so, if you're in Las Vegas. The only issue I had was that the toilet cover would slide to the side a bit when sitting on it and the bathroom toiletries were not top-quality. I even found a used soap at the sink. Also, the first day the cleaning staff did not come by until it was too late (around 4pm?) to clean up. They missed the second day, too. There is no room service. So we had to order food in which was fine because the front desk staff gave us delivery menus (American, Italian, Thai, etc.) and the food can be delivered direct to your room. The Thai is excellent! I was very surprised as the portions were huge, the prices cheap (all under $10), and the dishes we ordered were very tasty (almost authentic Thai and very spicy, if you ask for it). I had read here at Tripadvisor that the breakfast at the hotel was really good, but we did not experience any of it because we woke up late each morning. Breakfast takes place in a large room with a TV screen on CNBC. The room didn't look too special, but it appeared they had unlimited soda and coffee available. The guests are basically middle-class Americans. There was one thug-like type with low-hanging jeans with his somewhat trashy-looking girlfriend. But I didn't mind them too much as they seemed alright people. Anyhow, I really enjoyed my stay here. It was very comfortable and again the staff are excellent. SUMMARY: The staff at Staybridge Suites are really great and the black lady is awesome! I love her. At the prices they charge, this is a top value even in Las Vegas and I noticed two separate incidents when guests asked for long-term or frequent guest rates as they seemed to very much like the place. They were both people who apparently come often to Las Vegas, so I assume they know comparative value. I agree with their assessments as I would definitely stay here again, especially for a longer stay in the city.

HotelInfo.Name: Staybridge Suites Las Vegas
HotelInfo.Address: 5735 Dean Martin Drive, Las Vegas, NV 89118
